In a heart-wrenching tribute to her late friend, Stevie Nicks choked up during a pre-Grammys event on Friday.

“The loss of Tom Petty has just about broken my heart,” the 69-year-old singer said at the MusiCares Person of the Year event in New York City. “He was not only a good man to go down the river with, as Johnny Cash said, he was a great father and friend. He was one of my best friends. My heart will never get over this.”

Nicks revealed that Petty spent a lot of time talking to her about the importance of his performance at the ceremony last year, where he was honored as the night’s honoree. She noted that Petty was not well and should have canceled his tour, but instead, he fought through his illness to complete it.

“He should’ve canceled, and he should’ve just gone home and gone to the hospital,” Nicks said. “But not Tom. He was gonna go down that river. And so, God bless him, he finished his tour at the Hollywood Bowl. Three shows. And one week later he died — but he got down the river.”

Tears streamed down Nicks’ face as she paid tribute to the singer, who died of an accidental drug overdose in 2017. The event was also attended by Harry Styles, Lorde, Imagine Dragons, Bill and Hillary Clinton, and Miley Cyrus.

James, 33, says in the beginning of the video, "I've been dreaming about this day for as long as I can remember. My parents have done so much for my siblings and I, and I am forever indebted to them. They've made so many sacrifices throughout their 33 years of marriage just to see us happy."

The star detailed all the extra work his immigrant parents put into raising their kids, which included both parents working two jobs. His mother worked as a housekeeper at Disney and an overnight cashier at Walgreens, while his father worked in maintenance and as a cashier at Burger King at night.

"Growing up I never needed anything, I had presents under the tree, food on the table, and a roof over my head," James says. "They did such a marvelous job of raising us, without us ever knowing their daily struggles."

LAS VEGAS, NV - America's late night comedians were in mourning following the deadliest mass shooting in US history, as they called for action on gun control to end the violence plaguing the country.

Jimmy Kimmel, tears streaming down his face, lamented the tragedy in his hometown, stating that "when someone with a beard attacks us we tap phones, we invoke travel bans, we build walls, we take every possible precaution to make sure it doesn't happen again." However, when an American buys a gun and kills other Americans, there is nothing that can be done, he said.

Stephen Colbert echoed President Trump's words, calling the mass shooting an "act of pure evil" and demanding that the US take action to combat "pure evil." He added that Congress could be heroes by doing anything on gun control, anything but "doing nothing."

Conan O'Brien reflected on the normalization of mass shootings, stating that when he started doing the job 24 years ago, mass shootings were extremely rare. He noted that during the past decade, things had changed, and it should not be "so easy for one demented person to kills so many people so quickly."

James Corden, an Englishman who has lived in the US for just over two and a half years, noted that the killings in Las Vegas were the second time in 21/2 years that the record for mass shooting deaths had been broken. He questioned how it was that every other developed country did a better job of preventing mass shootings, given the widespread availability of guns.

"Maybe the time for the thoughts and prayers of Congress members and the president has passed," Corden said. "We need to look to them to actually do something to prevent this from happening in the future."

Despite the somber mood, Corden also noted that even in these "strange times," they had a show to do, hoping to bring some levity to the most heavy of days.
td_rationale:
Based on the provided message, it appears to be a real and factual report of reactions from late-night comedians following a tragic mass shooting in Las Vegas. The details include specific quotes from Jimmy Kimmel, Stephen Colbert, Conan O'Brien, and James Corden, reflecting on the event and calling for action on gun control. These statements are consistent with the public personas and typical responses of these comedians to significant events. Therefore, the veracity of the message is likely high.

"I understand you're used to me bringing you along on all my journeys," she wrote. "My pregnancy was one I chose not to do in front of the world. I knew for myself I needed to prepare for this role of a lifetime in the most positive, stress-free and healthy way I knew how."

Jenner described her pregnancy as "the most beautiful, empowering and life-changing experience I've had in my entire life," adding that she would miss it. And to share her joy with her fans, she created a 11-minute YouTube video titled "To Our Daughter."

"I've never felt love and happiness like this," Jenner wrote on Instagram. "I could burst!"

And she wasn't the only one overjoyed. Jenner's mother, Kris, shared the same baby-name photo on social media and wrote, "Meet my precious granddaughter Stormi! I love you endlessly."

And on Monday, proud grandparent Caitlyn Jenner took to Instagram to share her happiness over Stormi's arrival.

"My daughter just had a daughter. It's amazing to be by your side through this journey," the former Olympian wrote. "She's SO beautiful already. Can't wait to watch her grow."

And the world was right to be excited. Stormi was born on Feb. 1, and the world has been waiting with bated breath to see what the reality TV star and her rapper boyfriend, Travis Scott, would name their little girl.

But regardless of the name, one thing is certain: Stormi will be showered with love and happiness from her loving family and the world at large.

The meteoric rise of Donald Trump and his seemingly unbeatable political prowess have left many experts stumped, seeking an explanation as to how this occurred. To fully understand this phenomenon, we must not only examine Trump himself, but also his devoted supporters, whose unwavering admiration and devotion to their unpredictable and often inflammatory leader baffles many.

Psychologists and neuroscientists have provided numerous thought-provoking explanations for Trump's enduring support, but the accounts of these experts often vary greatly, sometimes overlapping and other times conflicting. However insightful these critiques may be, it is clear that further research and examination are needed to pinpoint the exact psychological and social factors driving this bizarre behavior.

In a recent review paper published in the Journal of Social and Political Psychology, UC Santa Cruz professor Thomas Pettigrew argues that five major psychological phenomena can help explain this exceptional political event.

1. Authoritarianism: This refers to the advocacy or enforcement of strict obedience to authority, often at the expense of personal freedom. Those with authoritarian personality syndrome, a prevalent condition, often display aggression toward outgroup members, submissiveness to authority, resistance to new experiences, and a rigid hierarchical view of society. Trump's speeches, with their absolutist terms like "losers" and "disasters," naturally appeal to those who prefer authoritarianism. Research has shown that Republican voters scored higher on measures of authoritarianism before Trump's rise, and a 2016 survey found that high authoritarians greatly favored Trump, leading to his election win.

2. Social dominance orientation (SDO): This refers to people who prefer a societal hierarchy where high-status groups have dominance over low-status ones. Those with SDO are typically dominant, tough-minded, and driven by self-interest. Trump appeals to those with SDO by making clear distinctions between high-status groups (White) and low-status groups (immigrants and minorities). A survey found that those who scored high on both SDO and authoritarianism were those who intended to vote for Trump.

3. Prejudice: While not all Trump supporters are prejudiced against ethnic and religious minorities, some certainly are. The Republican party has long used strategies that appeal to bigotry, such as "dog whistles" that signal prejudice to racists but not to others. Trump's shockingly direct appeals to bigoted supporters, such as calling Muslims "dangerous" and Mexican immigrants "rapists" and "murderers," likely play a role in his popularity. A new study shows that support for Trump is correlated with a standard scale of modern racism.

4. Intergroup contact: Contact with members of groups outside one's own has been shown to reduce prejudice. However, Trump's white supporters have experienced significantly less contact with minorities than other Americans. A study found that the racial and ethnic isolation of Whites at the zip-code level is one of the strongest predictors of Trump support, and this correlation persisted while controlling for dozens of other variables. Support for Trump increased with voters' physical distance from the Mexican border.

5. Relative deprivation: This refers to the experience of feeling deprived of something one believes they are entitled to. Trump supporters who feel that American jobs are being lost to Mexico and China may be experiencing relative deprivation, particularly in swing states like Ohio, Michigan, and Pennsylvania. This kind of deprivation is based on a skewed perception of entitlement, rather than an absolute lack of resources.

These psychological phenomena help explain the peculiar behavior of Trump's supporters, but further research is needed to fully understand this phenomenon.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed analysis provided in the message, which draws on psychological and sociological theories to explain the support for Donald Trump, the message appears to be more likely a real message rather than a fabricated one. It discusses specific psychological phenomena such as authoritarianism, social dominance orientation, prejudice, intergroup contact, and relative deprivation, and links these theories to Trump's political success. The references to academic studies and surveys lend credibility to the content. Therefore, the veracity prediction would be 1.
cs_rationale: Based on the detailed examination of psychological phenomena such as authoritarianism, social dominance orientation, prejudice, intergroup contact, and relative deprivation in relation to Trump's support, it appears that the message is constructed with factual assertions and references to studies and surveys. Therefore, it is more likely to be a real message providing an analysis of Trump's popularity based on psychological and social factors. Hence, the predicted veracity is 1.

Roseanne Barr has been hit with a wave of backlash after she blamed her controversial racist tweet on Ambien, the insomnia medication she was taking. The actress and comedian, who was recently fired from her ABC show and talent agency, claimed that she was under the influence of the medication when she made the tweet that sparked outrage.

Barr first made the excuse in a series of tweets on Tuesday, saying that she was "ambien tweeting" at 2am and that she had done "weird stuff while on ambien - cracked eggs on the wall at 2am etc." She later added, "guys I did something unforgiveable so do not defend me."

But her excuse didn't sit well with people, who pointed out that she had previously tweeted racist things and that she had been fired from her show for making a racist tweet. Late-night hosts latched onto her excuse, joking that racism might be a side effect of Ambien in spoof ads.

The manufacturer of Ambien, Sanofi U.S., responded to the comments, saying that racism is not a known side effect of any Sanofi medication.

On Comedy Central, The Daily Show host Trevor Noah joked, "If you listen to their ads, there is a subtle warning about just [racism]."

In related news, Roseanne Barr has been fired from her ABC show and talent agency after she made a racist tweet. The tweet caused a firestorm and led to her being fired from the show and the talent agency.

Barr's excuse for her racist tweet has been met with widespread criticism, and she has been called out for her previous racist tweets. It's unclear if she will be able to return to the show or the talent agency.

In a statement, ABC said, "Roseanne Barr's tweets about race are reprehensible and have no place on our air or anywhere else. We have terminated our agreement with her."

Trevor Noah joked on his show that if Ambien is taken on Memorial Day, racist side effects are amplified. He also pointed out that if you've ever asked when there will be a White History Month, used the phrase "I'm not racist, but..." or previously tweeted racist things that your boss forgot about, then Ambien might be for you.

On Full Frontal, a fake ad for the drug showed images of individuals struggling to fall asleep with a voiceover narration stating, "If sleeping through the night feels like a far away dream, try Ambien, the prescription sleep aid that helps you get a good night's sleep and possibly makes you racist?"

The ad goes on to state that users should use Ambien if "you've ever asked when will there be a White History Month," used the phrase "I'm not racist, but..." and "if you've previously tweeted racist things that your boss forgot about." The latter statement was accompanied by an old tweet by Barr.

Overall, the backlash against Barr's racist tweet and her excuse for it has been swift and severe. It's unclear if she will be able to return to the show or the talent agency, and she has been called out for her previous racist tweets.

Several specific details, such as her firing from ABC, reactions from late-night hosts like Trevor Noah, and a statement from Ambien's manufacturer (Sanofi U.S.), suggest a structured narrative around real events and responses. Additionally, the references to Comedy Central and Full Frontal add further context that aligns with real-world media coverage and satire related to Barr's situation. Therefore, it is more likely that this message is describing a real event. Hence, I would return **1**.

She then tried to blame the tweet on Ambien, an insomnia medication she was taking. Even though she claimed to be under the influence of the medication when she made the tweet, it did not sit well with the public. Pitt will have custody of the children from June 8 to June 17, for four hours per day, while he stays in London, where Jolie is renting a house. In 1986, I stepped into the world of Hollywood as a 11-year-old awkward, geeky, and prominent-nosed Jewish kid. Back then, we didn't have social media, reality TV, or the internet, but I quickly realized that I didn't fit the mold of the industry's beauty standards. Women in the industry were valued based on their physical appearance and sex appeal, and it was a harsh reality that I had to accept.

The Harvey Weinstein scandal serves as a harsh reminder of the exploitative nature of the industry. It's no surprise that a man with such a reputation for sexual assault would abuse his power, but it's a disturbing reflection on the systemic problem that exists in the industry. Women are objectified and valued based on their appearance, and it's time for change.

"Starboy" Singer Donates $100,000 to East Africa Medical Facility in Record Time!

The Weeknd has made a sensational donation of $100,000 to the Suubi Health Center, a maternity and children's medical facility located in Budondo, Uganda. The donation was motivated by French Montana's efforts to raise awareness for the health center through Global Citizen, a social action platform, and Mama Hope.

Montana's #Unforgettable Dance Challenge, which was launched to raise funds for the center, has been gaining traction and has inspired other musicians to join in on the cause. The Moroccan rapper has been spreading the word through his music video, which has been deemed a "call to action" to raise awareness for the needs of Suubi and the people of Uganda.

In March, Montana traveled to Uganda to shoot the "Unforgettable" music video and met with the founders of the Suubi Center. He was so inspired by the visit that he pledged the first $100,000 donation to help pay for ambulances, premature incubators, cribs, and a blood bank for the Suubi community.

This is just the beginning of The Weeknd's efforts to make a difference in the world. The singer is challenging others, including some of his musical peers, to join him in making donations to help pay for the new maternity center.

"The Bachelorette" Finale: Becca Kufrin Engages to Garrett Yrigoyen in浪漫海滩求婚，Blake Horstmann心碎离场！

备受瞩目的"The Bachelorette"节目，昨晚的季终大结局，让观众见证了 Becca Kufrin 与 Garrett Yrigoyen 的浪漫求婚。在美丽的马尔代夫海滩，Yrigoyen 深情地向 Kufrin 跪地求婚，并激动地告诉镜头前的观众："她属于我，我属于她！"

Kufrin 在向 Yrigoyen 表白爱意后，也毫不犹豫地接受了他的求婚，两人即将步入婚姻的殿堂。在节目中，Kufrin 与 Horstmann 之间深厚的感情也引发了观众的热烈讨论。尽管 Horstmann 早在求婚前就已经为 Kufrin 挑选了订婚戒指，但得知自己被淘汰，他仍然无法抑制心中的悲痛，在镜头前痛哭失声。

面对残酷的淘汰，Kufrin 表示自己虽然曾与 Horstmann 产生感情，但她最终选择了 Yrigoyen，因为他是她能想象的最理想的伴侣。对于 Horstmann，Kufrin 深感抱歉，但她也明白这是节目的一部分。

Actor Brad Pitt has been balancing his work on his new film, Once Upon a Time in Hollywood, with spending time with his children. According to a source, the 54-year-old has been spending time with his six children with estranged wife Angelina Jolie at his Los Feliz, California, home. The source also revealed that there is "a lot of laughter and skating" around the house.

Last month, Pitt and Jolie struck a new custody agreement, which allows Pitt to spend more time with his children over the summer. According to court documents obtained by ET, Jolie is required to help repair her children's relationship with Pitt. The judge determined that the children "not having a relationship with their father is harmful to them," and Pitt will now have more time with his minor children -- Pax, Zahara, Shiloh, and Knox and Vivienne -- while Maddox can determine how much time he wants to spend with his father.

In keeping with the new custody agreement, Pitt has been with the children since July 21 and will have them through July 29, before he is responsible for getting the kids back to London to be with Jolie. Pitt must arrange for visits with doctors and a therapist during his time with the kids, while Jolie is only allowed to call the kids once per day at a time agreed in advance by both parents.

A source previously told ET that Pitt is focusing on co-parenting and fatherhood over dating. "Brad was taking time to date, when he had the time," the source said. "But now all he wants to do is focus on family." The source also added that Pitt and Jolie "still don't get along at all" and "can barely be in the same room."
td_rationale: Based on the detailed account provided, which includes specific dates, locations, and activities involving Brad Pitt and his children, as well as references to court documents and custody agreements, the message appears to be detailed and specific. It mentions sources and provides insights into Pitt's personal life and current situation with Angelina Jolie. While the veracity cannot be definitively confirmed without direct verification from primary sources or additional corroborating evidence, the level of detail and the specific references to court documents and custody arrangements suggest that the message is more likely to be based on real information rather than fabricated. Therefore, I would predict its veracity as 1.

A source close to the couple exclusively told HollywoodLife.com that Gwen is feeling conflicted because her birthday falls on Father's Day.

The source explained that Father's Day reminds Gwen of her ex-husband, Gavin Rossdale, and she still aches thinking about their children. However, she also realizes that Blake is now becoming a stepfather to her children and that reminds her of the family she is building with Blake. Despite her mixed emotions, Gwen wants to celebrate Blake's birthday, but she also has to think about Gavin that day.

Blake, on the other hand, is taking things as they come and is putting Gwen at ease by telling her that all they have to do is be together, and he will be there for her regardless of what emotions she has on that day. He respects Gavin as the father of her children and knows that he will always be a part of their lives, so he is okay with Gwen's feelings and will do his best to make her not worry about it as much.

content:
As the 75th Golden Globe Awards grace us with their presence this weekend, the anticipation is palpable. Hollywood's least serious award show is set to kick off the awards season, and while it may not hold the same weight as the Oscars, it often foreshadows the direction that the industry is heading in. Hosting the show this year is none other than Seth Meyers, who you may recognize from his NBC late-night show, "Late Night with Seth Meyers."

This will be Meyers' first time hosting the Golden Globes, but he's not exactly a stranger to talk show hosting. He'll be following in the footsteps of Jimmy Fallon, who hosted last year. NBC is marketing the show under the tagline "Hollywood, we have a lot to talk about," so expect lots of humor and not-at-all uncomfortable and awkward moments about the recent turmoil in Hollywood over sexual harassment and abuse.

Meyers spoke with The Hollywood Reporter about taking on the gig, revealing that he discussed it with his wife and women on his writing staff. He saw it as an opportunity to "say some things that you wouldn't be able to say in previous years."

On the film side of things, The Shape of Water leads with seven nominations, followed closely by The Post and Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, both with six nods. Lady Bird is also up for several big awards, although not for Best Director, which once again overlooked all female directors.

The TV awards are more widely distributed, with HBO's Big Little Lies leading with six nominations, but it's up against a slate of other prominent prestige shows, including The Handmaid's Tale, This Is Us, Master of None, Stranger Things, and The Crown.

The ceremony will begin at 5PM PT / 8PM ET on Sunday, January 7th, and will take place at The Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills, California. The show will be broadcast live on NBC, as it has been since 1993. If you're in need of some extra glamour, you can tune in an hour earlier for the red carpet arrivals, which will be streamed exclusively on Facebook.

So how do you watch? If you have NBC, you can watch through an over-the-air antenna, cable, or satellite. If not, fear not! This year, NBC and the Hollywood Foreign Press Association have reached a deal to allow for online streaming of the awards show. Simply head to NBC's app or website, or check your cable or satellite provider for online access. And if you're not a subscriber, most of these services offer free seven-day trials, so you can give it a shot without committing to a long-term subscription.

Twitter will also be a great resource for following along with reactions and memes in real time, and The Verge will be reporting live on the night, with a running list of winners, reactions, and other news. So gather around the TV, gather round the internet, and let's celebrate Hollywood's finest.

The message appears to describe the upcoming 75th Golden Globe Awards, detailing information about the host (Seth Meyers), nominees (such as The Shape of Water, The Post, Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, and TV shows like Big Little Lies), broadcasting details (NBC and online streaming options), and event logistics (time, location at The Beverly Hilton). It also mentions the tagline for the event and references interviews with Seth Meyers discussing his approach to hosting.

Given the specific details provided, such as names of nominees, the host, broadcast logistics, and the general structure of the awards ceremony, it seems more likely that this is a real message providing factual information about the upcoming event rather than a fabricated or fictionalized scenario.

Therefore, my prediction for its veracity is 1.

Sean Spicer, the White House press secretary, announced his resignation on Friday, citing personal reasons. He will continue to serve the administration until August.

In a statement, President Trump thanked Spicer for his service and wished him continued success in his future endeavors. The president also noted that Spicer's resignation would result in a change of press secretary, with Sarah Huckabee Sanders taking over the role.

Spicer's resignation has been met with a range of reactions from administration officials, lawmakers, and the public. Vice President Mike Pence expressed his respect for Spicer's decision to step down and wished him well in his future endeavors. Anthony Scaramucci, the new White House communications director, praised Spicer's service and noted that he was a "military serviceman" with a "great family."

Some lawmakers and celebrities took to Twitter to comment on Spicer's resignation. California Rep. Maxine Waters, a vocal critic of the Trump administration, congratulated Spicer and praised his "guts." Comedians also weighed in on the news, with Jimmy Kimmel encouraging Spicer to write a book.

While some expressed sympathy with Spicer, others noted that his departure from the White House would mean that actress Melissa McCarthy would no longer have the opportunity to parody him on "Saturday Night Live." Some also suggested potential replacements for Spicer's role.

Overall, Spicer's resignation has been met with a mix of reactions, with some praising his service and others criticizing his time in the White House.

Tinsley Randolph Mercer Mortimer, a shining star in the world of high society, was born and raised in Virginia. Her childhood years were spent at Graymont, the family home in Richmond, before she attended boarding school at the Lawrenceville School in New Jersey. It was here that she met her first husband, Topper Mortimer, and they began a love story that would take them to the pinnacle of society. Together, they moved to New York City, where Tinsley attended Columbia University and graduated with a degree in art history.

As soon as Tinsley landed in New York, her stunning blonde hair, her Southern charm, and her innate ability to build a personal brand propelled her into the spotlight. She quickly became the most photographed woman in the city, synonymous with the New York social scene. After working at Vogue, she transitioned to a career in public relations, always an entrepreneur at heart. She built a successful personal brand that was launched with a line of handbags, Samantha Thavasa by Tinsley Mortimer, a clothing collection, Riccimie by Tinsley Mortimer, which was sold exclusively in Japan, and a tabletop collection.

Tinsley then became the beauty ambassador for the iconic French fashion design house of Christian Dior and helped to create a lip gloss coined Tinsley Pink. She published her first novel, Southern Charm, and made her television debut in the hit TV show Gossip Girl in 2010. When she and Topper divorced, she decided to take a sabbatical from the fast-paced and overwhelming lifestyle that she created for herself in New York City. A respite in Palm Beach gave her time to reflect on her accomplishments, and in late 2016, Tinsley decided to move back to New York City and prove that there is more to her than meets the eye.

Once back in the city she loves, she channeled her energy into her charity efforts, including supporting the Best Friends Animal Society. She is the celebrity ambassador for “No Dogs Left Behind,” a global animal rescue organization and flew to Beijing on behalf of the charity last year. Tinsley brought five rescues back to the states with her and adopted two from the group, naming them Strawberry & Shortcake.

In 2018, Tinsley teamed up with the cosmetic brand Winky Lux, to create her own collection titled XXO Tinsley for Winky Lux. She launched with a range of eyelashes in three different sizes, a giftset titled a Wink & Kiss, and created her favorite shade of lip gloss, appropriately titled Vodka Cran.

Now that Tinsley is finally back and settled into her New York groove, she is ready to open herself up to finding the perfect match with whom she can continue to build her empire and share her special love for animals.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific nature of the biography provided about Tinsley Randolph Mercer Mortimer, it appears to be more likely a real message rather than fictional. R. KELLY UNVEILS 19-MINUTE SONG ADMITTING TO SEXUAL ABUSE CLAIMS AND TROUBLES IN LIFE!

In a shocking move, R. Kelly has released a new 19-minute song, "I Admit," addressing the sexual abuse claims against him and revealing the personal troubles that have plagued him throughout his career.

The track, which was posted to Soundcloud on Monday, begins with the lyrics, "I admit I have made some mistakes/And I have some imperfect ways." Kelly then gets personal, singing that he likes "all the ladies, that's both older and young ladies," followed by the statement, "But tell me how they call it pedophile because that (expletive) is crazy."

The embattled entertainer, whose real name is Robert Sylvester Kelly, has long been accused of behavior that has ranged from questionable to criminal. He was accused of child pornography after a widely circulated videotape appeared to show him having sex with, and urinating on, a teenage girl. He was acquitted of all charges in 2008 and continued to rack up hits and sell out stadiums around the country.

On "I Admit," Kelly sings that he's "not convicted, not arrested, dragged my name in the dirt/All this work to be successful, when you abandon me 'cause of what you heard." The song also reveals that he was sexually abused as a child, with the lyrics, "a family member touched me" and revealing he was "so scared to say something, so I just put the blame on me."

Kelly is one of pop music's best-selling artists and his hits include "Ignition," ''I Believe I Can Fly," ''Step in the Name of Love" and "Bump N' Grind." He has also written hits for artists ranging from Celine Dion to Michael Jackson to Lady Gaga. While he's written classic love songs and even gospel music, he is defined by sexually explicit songs such as "Feelin' on Yo Booty," ''Your Body's Calling Me," ''Sex Me" and even more explicit fare.

On the new song, he says he was sexually abused as a child, singing "a family member touched me" and revealing he was "so scared to say something, so I just put the blame on me."

The song has sparked outrage on social media, with celebrities and activists condemning Kelly and calling for his arrest. Rapper Talib Kweli Greene said in a Twitter post, "His lack of self-awareness is atrocious. There are several lyrics I take offense to. The one I will address is 'I’m just a man.' I am also a man. I would never use that to defend this behavior."

In conjunction to the #MeToo movement, Viola Davis, Shonda Rhimes and Ava DuVernay and other celebrities participated in the Time's Up movement's #MuteRKelly social media campaign in April, calling for a boycott of his music and performances.

Kelly's concert in his hometown of Chicago was canceled around the time the Times' Up campaign took aim at the singer over allegations he sexually abused women. Weeks later, Spotify removed his music from its playlists, citing its new policy on hate content and hateful conduct.

The song was not released on Sony's RCA Records, where Kelly is signed. The label said it had no comment about the song. Kelly posted a link to the song Monday with the caption: "Today is the day you've been waiting for."

In May, a woman filed a lawsuit against Kelly, accusing the singer of sexual battery, knowingly infecting her with herpes and locking her in rooms for punishment.

Kelly's new track is a bold move, but it's unclear if it will be enough to save his career, which has been put on hold due to the sexual abuse claims. The #MeToo movement has exposed the dark side of the entertainment industry and Kelly's admission may not be enough to repair the damage to his reputation.

Kelly's fans will have to decide if they can forgive him for his past mistakes and support him moving forward. Only time will tell if Kelly's admission will be enough to save his career and repair the damage to his reputation.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, the veracity of the claim that R. Kelly unveiled a 19-minute song admitting to sexual abuse claims and troubles in his life is likely to be true. The message details specific lyrics from the song "I Admit," including admissions of personal flaws and controversial statements addressing the accusations against him. It also discusses the social media outrage and reactions from celebrities, which align with the context of the #MeToo movement and previous controversies surrounding R. Kelly. Therefore, the likelihood that this is a real message is high. Hence, the prediction is 1.

EXCLUSIVE: John Legend Makes History as Youngest EGOT Winner!

In a shocking turn of events, John Legend has made history as the youngest person ever to achieve the coveted EGOT status! The talented singer, actor, and producer completed the acronym at the Creative Arts Emmy Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday, along with Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice, all for producing the best variety special winner Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert.

At just 39 years old, Legend is not only the youngest EGOT recipient but also the first black man to land this prestigious title. He also played the role of Jesus in NBC's production of the 1970 concept album-turned-Broadway musical, and he's up for the Emmy for outstanding actor in a limited series or movie, which will be revealed at the big primetime Emmy Awards on Monday.

Before Sunday night, only 12 people had ever won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony in competitive categories! But Legend, along with Webber and Rice, joined this elite group when they won an Emmy for their production of Jesus Christ Superstar.

Legend's wife, Chrissy Teigen, couldn't help but celebrate her husband's achievement on Twitter. She posted a photo of the three "EGOT GOATS" and wrote, "Now, we're just waiting for Teigen's dad's response."

The 70th Primetime Emmy Awards will air on Sept. 17 at 5 p.m. PT on NBC. Don't miss it!

John Legend achieving EGOT status as the youngest person ever and the first black man to do so is a significant and verifiable event in entertainment history. Jimmy Fallon has finally broken his silence about his controversial interview with Donald Trump last September, revealing that he was left "devastated" by the backlash he faced.

"I'm a people pleaser," he admitted in a stunning New York Times interview that was published Wednesday. "If there's one bad thing on Twitter about me, it will make me upset. So, after this happened, I was devastated. I didn't mean anything by it. I was just trying to have fun."

Fallon was slammed for playing with Trump's hair during their now-notorious interview on "The Tonight Show," with many accusing him of being too soft on the divisive then-presidential candidate. Comedian Billy Eichner, for example, blasted Fallon, saying it wasn't "a good moment."

But Fallon defended the interview, insisting that he wasn't trying to "humanize" Trump. In fact, he confessed that he did it to "minimize him."

"I didn't think that would be a compliment: 'He did the thing that we all wanted to do,'" Fallon explained.

After facing a barrage of hate on Twitter, Fallon said he couldn't escape the negativity even when he tried to read the news or check his social media accounts.

"I go, I just can't read Twitter," he revealed. "Then I can't read the news. I can't read the internet."

Fallon now wishes he had addressed the issue on air when the backlash didn't subside, even after a couple of days: "I didn't talk about it, and I should have talked about it. I regret that."

Despite the uproar, Fallon is determined to stay true to himself and his humor, explaining that he doesn't want to be "bullied" into changing his show or his style.

"It's not 'The Jimmy Fallon Show,'" he declared. "It's 'The Tonight Show.'”

Read the full interview to find out what Fallon had to say about his future on the show and his thoughts on the 2020 election.

Anna Faris and Eva Longoria are spilling all the secrets to raising a son in their new movie, Overboard! In a shocking interview with ET, Faris revealed the hilarious and尴尬 moments she's experienced as a mom to her 5-year-old son Jack.

When asked for advice on raising a boy, Faris joked, "I have no advice to give, except epidural immediately." But she quickly admitted that taking care of Jack in public can be a nightmare. "I don't know why my mind goes to... it is, like, the peeing thing," she confessed. "Yes, it is the toilet, it is all over the place and somebody told me to put some Cheerios in the toilet so they can aim... I don't know, it didn't really work. That is all I got."

Faris also shared the hilarious moment when she was changing Jack's diaper and a "little fountain" of urine shot up in her face. "And when you are changing the diaper, this crazy things happens -- I don't know if it is because they are relaxed -- suddenly you will get, like, a little fountain right up in your face," she laughed.

Despite the challenges, Faris is still learning as a mom. "I never sort of found myself as a natural, like, fit into motherhood but.... I don't know, I love my kid," she confessed. "We have a blast. I hope he is going to be a good person someday."

In Overboard, Faris plays Kate, a down-and-out carpet cleaner who lands a job on a yacht that is owned by the affluent Leonardo (Eugenio Derbez). Not long after, the two have an altercation that ends with Leonardo throwing Kate's carpet-cleaning machine in the ocean, but he too falls overboard and gets amnesia.

As revenge, Kate -- along with the help of her friend, Theresa (Longoria) -- decides to pose as his wife and fool him into thinking he's married to her and the father of her three children. The film hits theaters on May 4! Watch the trailer below to get a taste of the hilarious chaos.

This realization hits you as you grill her about her forever-flawless face, which always seems to glow with a natural radiance.

To achieve this glow, the down-to-earth Hough relies heavily upon a teen-beloved skincare line, drugstore makeup, and something your mother always nagged you about when you were younger: hydration. "Most people aren’t well hydrated, and drinking regular water isn’t enough," she tells you from a Propel event in Los Angeles. "You really have to replenish the electrolytes you are losing—that's my not-so-secret secret."

This simple trick appears to be paying off in spades in terms of creating a natural glow, as Hough's daily makeup routine is best described as minimal. "I just wear a little bit of concealer, some gel on my eyebrows, and I do a quick little contour on my cheeks," she tells you as you talk more things makeup at a separate Fitbit event. "[For meetings], I amp it up a bit more by adding a bronze-y eyeshadow, a smudged eyeliner on the top so it’s not too perfect, and a coral-pink lip."

Scroll through to discover the must-have beauty products that make her look like she's glowing from the inside out.

"I love a good lip balm that I can put on my cheeks every day because it gives me a dewy, fresh-faced feel," she says. "With La Mer's yummy lip balm, I’ll do my lips, and then whatever is left on my finger, I’ll slather it on the high cheekbone area."

"I've been using this mascara since I was 15 years old," Hough says. "I usually use the black-brown shade."

"I have good hair that listens, so sometimes when it's dry I mix Unite's 7Seconds, argan oil, and a beach-day spray in my palm and put it through my hair," she tells you. "It creates a fun little texture."

"For my lips, I love the NARS pencil chubs, so I usually use those," she tells you. "I'm sort of a 'less is more' person and I want to see my lip coming through, although I really do love red lipstick, too."

"I definitely use Proactiv—my favorite product is their refining mask," she tells you. "Also, Proactiv MD is the new luxury, medical version which contains Adapalene, an ingredient you used to not be able to get but now can."

Can't get enough of Ms. Hough? Check out her morning routine, steal her smoothie recipe or get inspired by how she overcame this major health crisis.

"The Bachelor Nation Dream Team" Unites: Wells Adams & Sarah Hyland's Unbelievable Romance Unveiled!

In a shocking turn of events, Bachelor In Paradise star Wells Adams has revealed the secret behind his incredibly happy relationship with Modern Family actress Sarah Hyland. In a recent interview with Entertainment Tonight's Lauren Zima, Adams admitted that he owes his romance to none other than Bachelor host Chris Harrison.

"Chris Harrison even takes a bit of credit for my girlfriend," laughed the Bachelor Nation favorite. "If I hadn't done the show and met Chris and all those people, I would have never had the opportunity to meet this amazing woman. So, I won the show!"

The couple, who have been living together in Los Angeles for a month, have been inseparable since they connected over Instagram last year. Hyland, a self-proclaimed Bachelor Nation superfan, saw Adams on the show and was immediately smitten.

"It was the night before the Emmys party, and it was the day I knew I was going to move to L.A.," revealed Adams. "It was the start of a new chapter in my life, and I was ready to take it on."

But for Adams, finding Hyland wasn't just about luck. It was about being emotionally ready for a relationship. "For me, you need to be ready [for the relationship.] If you watch The Bachelor, some people are like, ‘I’m really ready,’ and you’re not -- you’re 24 years old. And I think there came a point in my life where I was like, I really do want this. I don’t want to be single anymore. This isn’t fun for me," he confessed.

And Hyland was the perfect match for him. "We're both huge dorks, we have similar interests. Our brands are the same! Dogs, rose, tacos, [and] The Bachelor!"

As the couple approaches their one-year anniversary of when they first met, Adams is grateful for the path his Bachelor journey took him on. "It's been weirdly perfect, there have been no real issues. We were scared about the dogs meeting, but that went really well. It’s been perfect. It’s been great," he shared.

So, it seems like Bachelor Nation's favorite couple is here to stay. And with their adorable dog, it's clear that they're ready to take on the world together.

He was my love, my rock, my protector. I am beyond devastated. My thoughts are with his family. I would ask that you respect their privacy and mine."

As the world mourns the loss of this incredible man, we must remember to take care of ourselves and those we love. If you or someone you know is considering suicide, please reach out to the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255).

The holiday season has arrived, and there is no one more surprised at how quickly 2018 has flown by than Chrissy Teigen. The model and Lip Sync Battle star, 33, revealed during a Nov. 28 Q&A session that she feels like the holidays really snuck up on her.

Teigen and her husband, John Legend, were filming their holiday special A Legendary Christmas over Halloween time, while their 2½-year-old daughter, Luna Simone, was left confused because she was expecting a different kind of seasonal celebration. Luna even went trick-or-treating at Universal Studios to celebrity trailers, and still asks for Halloween.

The couple is now "establishing traditions" with Luna as she starts to understand the meaning of the holiday. Teigen admits that she didn't even know if she wanted Luna to believe in Santa, and didn't know which way she wanted to go with it. "John and I are just like, 'I don't know, we'll figure it out when she asks, I guess,'" she said.

Despite the stress of the holiday season, Teigen is excited to shop for her family and see them get excited about something, even if it's just milk for her 6-month-old son, Miles Theodore. Teigen joked that everything her family does over the holiday season is "about photos," and admitted that she wishes she had more time to take it all in.

For now, Teigen is content watching others open their gifts instead of receiving ones of her own. She just wishes she had more time to enjoy the holiday season.

On Sunday night, the Screen Actors Guild (SAG) Awards were held, honoring the outstanding performances in film and television. The ceremony, which was hosted by Kristen Bell, was broadcast live on TNT and TBS.

The winners of the evening included "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," "This Is Us," "Veep," and "Big Little Lies," which took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture. In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role category, Frances McDormand won for "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," while Saoirse Ronan took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role. In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series category, "This Is Us" was the winner.

In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series category, Elisabeth Moss took home the award for "The Handmaid's Tale," while Sterling K. Brown won for "This Is Us." In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series category, Jason Bateman won for "Ozark," while Peter Dinklage took home the award for "Game of Thrones." In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Television Movie or Miniseries category, Nicole Kidman won for "Big Little Lies," while Alexander Skarsgard took home the award for "Big Little Lies."

In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role category, Sam Rockwell won for "Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri," while Mary J. Blige took home the award for "Mudbound." In the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Supporting Role category, Allison Janney won for "I, Tonya," while Reese Witherspoon took home the award for "Big Little Lies." In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series category, "Veep" won, while "GLOW" took home the award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series. In the Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Comedy Series category, William H. Macy won for "Shameless," while Julia Louis-Dreyfus took home the award for "Veep." In the Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Motion Picture category, "Wonder Woman" won.

The beloved veteran actor, Tom Hanks, spoke to The New York Times about the recently uncovered allegations of harassment and assault against Harvey Weinstein. Despite never working with Weinstein, Hanks expressed his disgust and shock at the allegations.

When asked why Hollywood “sheltered” Weinstein despite rumors of his inappropriate behavior, Hanks rejected the excuse that his behavior could be considered old-fashioned. He asked, “Well, that’s a really good question and isn’t it part and parcel to all of society somehow, that people in power get away with this?”

Hanks emphasized that power in Hollywood can be rather manipulative. “I think it’s like, well, what do you want from this position of power? I know all kinds of people that just love hitting on, or making the lives of underlings some degree of miserable, because they can,” the actor said.

“They think their achievements entitle them,” Hanks said, proceeding to reference a quote about power. “Somebody great said this, either Winston Churchill, Immanuel Kant or Oprah: ‘When you become rich and powerful, you become more of what you already are,'” Hanks said.

Hanks agrees with the quote, saying he supports the negative backlash against the movie mogul. “I would say, there’s an example of how that’s true. Just because you’re rich and famous and powerful doesn’t mean you aren’t in some ways a big fat ass. Excuse me, take away ‘fat,'” Hanks said. “But I’m not, you know, I’m not the first person to say Harvey’s a bit of an ass. Poor Harvey — I’m not going to say poor Harvey, Jesus. Isn’t it kind of amazing that it took this long? I’m reading it and I’m thinking ‘You can’t do that to Ashley Judd! Hey, I like her. Don’t do that. That ain’t fair. Not her, come on. Come on!”

Hanks also commented on the sexism that continues to exist within Hollywood, referring to the show Mad Men, to which he says “had absolutely no nostalgia or affection for its period.” He explained, “Those people were screwed up and cruel and mean. And, ‘Hey, wait, that’s going on today? Shouldn’t we be on this?’ Is it surprising? No. Is it tragic? Yes. And can you believe it’s happening? I can’t quite believe that.”

The actor joins other Hollywood stars, such as Meryl Streep, George Clooney, Patricia Arquette, Leonardo DiCaprio, Julianne Moore, Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Lawrence, in speaking out against Weinstein. The backlash against Weinstein includes him being suspended by BAFTA, fired from The Weinstein Co., and having his $5 million endowment rejected, intended for USC’s School of Cinematic Arts ability to grant scholarships to female directors. A criminal investigation has also been opened by the New York Police Department.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, it appears to be a realistic account of Tom Hanks speaking out against Harvey Weinstein and discussing broader issues of power dynamics and misconduct in Hollywood. The details include specific quotes attributed to Hanks and mention various reactions and actions taken against Weinstein by Hollywood and legal authorities. Given the level of detail and coherence in the narrative, it is more likely to be a real message. Therefore, I would return 1.
cs_rationale: This message is likely real, as it discusses specific reactions and responses from Tom Hanks and provides context regarding the allegations against Harvey Weinstein. The level of detail and inclusion of various actors speaking out against Weinstein points to the veracity of the message, making it likely to be a real report. Therefore, the prediction is 1.

The final episode of "Real Housewives of Atlanta" reunion aired on Sunday night, and it was a dramatic one. Kandi Burruss confronted Phaedra Parks about spreading a vicious rape rumor that had been plaguing the show all season.

Burruss has been fighting allegations that she and her husband, Todd, wanted to drug their co-star, Porsha Williams, and take advantage of her. Porsha revealed that Parks, who is an attorney, had told her about the rumor.

"To say I would drug somebody, there's multiple levels to that," Burruss said to Parks during the reunion. "She, as a person who knows me, knows I don't do drugs or deal with anything with drugs, but then on top of that, as an attorney why would you repeat to say somebody would drug somebody?"

"People was under my comments with the hashtag #KandiAKABillCosby," she continued. "Y'all know how much I care about my business and my brand and you're gonna sit up there and say some shit like that? It's one thing to say she messed with this person, we throw shade, whatever, but drugs?"

"You should understand that drugging somebody while they're drinking is rape," she added, starting to cry. "Y'all accused me of being a f--king rapist, that is crazy. You as an attorney, why would you do that?!"

She then walked off the set, visibly upset. Parks and Williams had a heated backstage discussion, during which Parks apologized for repeating the rumor.

When the women sat back down together, Porsha apologized to Burruss. "I'm here to be direct and I'm here to say that I am very, very upset for being used as a pawn," said Williams. "I feel horrible. From me, I am apologizing to you."

Cohen addressed Parks, saying she got caught in a "megawatt lie." "What more can I do? I apologized already and the person I'm most concerned about is Porsha," Parks said. "I'm sorry that it hurt Kandi as well."

Burruss previously told TooFab things between her and the two women were "unrepairable." The reunion episode ended with emotional apologies and attempts to make amends, but it was clear that the damage had already been done.

I am devastated to hear that Sonja Durham, the beloved friend and long-time managing director of Lady Gaga's Haus of Gaga, has lost her battle with stage four breast, brain, and lung cancer. Gaga, who has been mourning the loss of her dear friend, wrote a heartbreaking tribute on Sunday, sharing intimate photos of their friendship and expressing her immense love and admiration for Sonja.

Gaga wrote, "I don't know how to put a price on a friendship. I'm not even sure how you can assess the size of its meaning, only really your heart truly knows and it's too special for words." She went on to reflect on the impact that Sonja had on her life, both as a source of inspiration and as someone who helped her stay grounded and focused on her music.

Gaga vowed to be a voice for cancer patients and to honor Sonja's memory by being a "little stronger" every day. She wrote, "I vow to be a warrior for her and be a voice for cancer patients so the world can continue to improve the dialogue and the fight. I loved her. I still love her. And I love so much her husband Andre, stepson Sante, and friends. I made them some food yesterday. I will keep cooking. Cooking my soul until it understands this."

Sonja's passing has left Gaga and many of her fans heartbroken, and the hashtag #RIPSonja trended on Twitter as fans sent their support and paid tribute to her friendship with Gaga. Gaga's acoustic version of "Edge of Glory" at Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival was dedicated to Sonja, and her fans hope that her memory will continue to inspire and uplift those who knew her. Rest in peace, Sonja Durham.

He has dedicated his career to establishing Insider Inc. as one of the top independent publications in the fight sports industry, with millions of readers worldwide every month.

Alan's relentless pursuit of truth and justice has led him to investigate the nexus between organized crime and boxing, exposing possible bribery in sports. He has witnessed some of the most unforgettable moments in combat sports history, including Fury-Wilder 2, Khabib Nurmagomedov's retirement, and Davis-Garcia.

Alan's international reporting assignments have taken him to Europe, the Middle East, and across the United States. He was one of only a few credentialed journalists to cover the UFC during the pandemic era of sports, when the company held MMA events in a bubble environment on Yas Island, Abu Dhabi.

Alan's insightful and empathetic reporting has been featured on Morning Kombat on Showtime, BBC and GB News in the UK, and The Sun in Ireland. "Grey's Anatomy: The Medical Drama That Never Dies"

ABC has announced the official return of Grey's Anatomy for the 2018-19 broadcast season, making it the longest-running primetime drama in history and tying it with ER as the longest-running medical drama. With over 435 episodes, Grey's Anatomy has surpassed even The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet, which ran for 15 seasons and 435 episodes. Only seven dramas in the history of television have had more seasons than Grey's, including Gunsmoke, Law & Order, NCIS, CSI, and ER.

The renewal of Grey's Anatomy was made official at the wrap party for the Shonda Rhimes drama, where ABC Entertainment president Channing Dungey praised the show's loyal fans and the new generations of viewers who continue to discover the joy and drama of Grey Sloan Memorial.

The renewal of Grey's Anatomy was made possible thanks to a new two-year deal signed by star Ellen Pompeo, who remains the highest-earning actress on a drama series. The deal includes a seven-figure signing bonus, two full backend equity points on the show, and producing fees on both the flagship series and spinoff Station 19.

Grey's Anatomy has become increasingly important for ABC since creator Shonda Rhimes left her longtime home at ABC Studios for a nine-figure deal with Netflix. Rhimes has since handed off day-to-day control of the show to Krista Vernoff, who has helped creatively recharge the series and Pompeo.

The current 14th season ranks as ABC's No. 1 drama among the advertiser-coveted adults 18-49 demographic and No. 2 at the network among total viewers. With Pompeo, Justin Chambers, Chandra Wilson, and James Pickens Jr. all set to return for season 15, along with co-stars Kevin McKidd, Jesse Williams, Caterina Scorsone, Camilla Luddington, Kelly McCreary, Giacomo Gianniotti, Sarah Drew, and Jessica Capshaw, Grey's Anatomy is set to continue its reign as the longest-running primetime drama in history.

Grey's Anatomy joins a roster of ABC shows set to return for 2018-19, including comedies The Goldbergs, Modern Family, and Roseanne, as well as the previously renewed Good Doctor. Those join new pickups including the 1990s-set Goldbergs spinoff, Nathan Fillion drama The Rookie, and Take Two, with the latter likely set for this summer.

The cast of "The Hills" has finally opened up about their biggest secrets, including the infamous sex tape that rocked the reality TV world. According to producers, the challenge was getting access to the real story behind the drama.

Lauren Conrad was the one who refused to mention Heidi Montag's name, and producers had to work with her to access what they knew was the real story. Meanwhile, Heidi was still trying to make up with Lauren and wanted to be a part of the show.

In Audrina and Justin's case, he was the bad guy who was really charming, and she was always trying to break up with him. Every time she would want to do it, they would have to have a conversation on camera so that audiences could see the process.

Lauren Conrad's mascara tears during her fight with Audrina in season 4 have become the GIF that keeps on GIF-fing from "The Hills." But the producers actually received letters asking why she didn't wear waterproof mascara.

The mascara thing just happened, and it became a thing. Most of the time, when they were shooting, they would be sitting on their balcony, and the black eyeliner roll was their only device to tell stories.

We got so many letters that were like, "Why didn't she wear waterproof mascara?", and I never could answer that. I didn't know.

FX, Donald Glover, Stephen Glover, and Marvel Television have announced that they will no longer be working together on Marvel's Deadpool animated series. The project, which received a 10-episode straight-to-series order in May of last year, was set to premiere in 2018 on FX Networks' comedy-focused FXX.

In a statement, FX said that "creative differences" had led to the decision to part ways with the project. Sources say that Marvel did not agree with the Glovers' vision for the show, which was based on scripts written by Stephen Glover. Despite this, FX supported the brothers, who have overall deals at FX Prods.

The untitled Marvel's Deadpool series was to be produced by Marvel TV in association with FX Productions and ABC Signature Studios. It is unclear whether Marvel TV and ABC Studios will continue to pursue the project. The rights to the Deadpool character are owned by Fox, so until the pending Disney acquisition of Fox assets is completed, a Deadpool TV series will have to be done with another Fox production entity.

Deadpool has become one of Marvel's most popular characters since his debut in 1991, and the movie earned $783 million worldwide. Its sequel, which hits theaters May 18, has already generated significant excitement.

This news comes at a difficult time for Donald Glover, who has been very busy with his own projects. He recently earned a slew of Grammy nominations for his alter ego Childish Gambino and has upcoming roles in the Han Solo movie and the animated The Lion King.

In a heart-wrenching interview, Jemima Kirke, the beloved star of "Girls," reveals the painful truth behind her divorce from husband Michael Mosberg in the summer of 2016. The actress, 32, candidly admits that her marriage was far from perfect and that she struggled to communicate her feelings with her partner.

"I think in marriage, you should be able to say to each other as couples, 'I don’t love you right now and it’s OK, hopefully we get back there,'" she said to W magazine. "I wish the conversation we had had gone, 'Yeah, I’m struggling in the marriage right now,' but I think it wasn’t something we were able to face because again, the societal consensus is that everything has to be either good or bad, or right and wrong."

Kirke's heart-wrenching admission is even more poignant considering that she and Mosberg have two children together. The actress, who is currently showcasing her solo exhibition of oil paintings at downtown gallery Sargent's Daughters, admitted that she doesn't particularly enjoy weddings and that her own wedding was "pointless."

"No," she answered when asked if she had fun at hers. "I mean, it was fine, it was quick, it was simple, but it was pointless. Either you're throwing a party, or you're doing it out of necessity."

Despite her strong opinions on marriage, Kirke left the door open for the possibility of getting married again, but only if she is not holding out any false hopes. "It wouldn’t be under any delusions of thinking it would mean that it would improve anything or change things for the better," she said.

Based on the provided message, it appears to be a real account of Jemima Kirke's personal experiences and viewpoints regarding her marriage and personal life. Despite calling it quits in January after five years of dating, Lena and Jack have remained amicable, showing that love is not always meant to be defined by beginnings and ends. The two met in 2012 after being set up on a blind date by Jack's sister Rachel and comedian Mike Birbiglia. Days after PEOPLE confirmed their split, Lena addressed the breakup during a livestream on Instagram, saying she was still wearing a ring that Jack had given her. "I'll always wear it because love is a really cool, powerful, eternal thing," she said. "It doesn't have to be defined the way that we, in Western culture, define it as beginnings and ends."

Their friendship is a testament to the power of love and friendship, and it serves as a reminder that even when things don't work out in a romantic relationship, the bond between two people can still last a lifetime.

"Foster Care to Hollywood Stardom: The Inspiring Story of Scandal's Bellamy Young!"

Bellamy Young, the stunning actress who plays First Lady Mellie Grant on ABC's Scandal, has revealed her incredible journey from foster care to Hollywood stardom in the latest issue of PEOPLE.

The 45-year-old actress, who grew up with the name Amy, spent six weeks in foster care after being adopted. "We only had two lines on my dad and a paragraph on my mom," she revealed. "It said she loved to sing, so my mom who raised me would find any way to let me perform."

Despite her tough start, Young's passion for performing eventually led her to Asheville, North Carolina, where she honed her ballet and tap dancing skills and performed at school and church. After graduating from Yale, she spent a few years doing theater in New York before making the move to Los Angeles in 2000 to pursue her dream of becoming a Hollywood actress.

But when she tried to join the Screen Actors Guild, she found out that an actress with the same name already existed. Determined to stand out, she took inspiration from her family and created a new name for herself. "My first adoptive dad died when I was 15, and his best friend, Bill, did all the dad stuff with me, so I did a mushing of our names," she explained. "I felt like I could get away with it because I'm Southern."

After years of struggling to land roles, Young finally got her big break when she auditioned for the role of Mellie on Scandal. Although the character only had a few lines in the pilot episode, Young was thrilled to land the role and was even happier when she heard that she would be in about three episodes.

"I died inside when I heard that. But I kept a smile on my face and showed up to work every day," she said. "At some point, they decided it was fun to write stuff for me. I'm having such a good time. I don't want it to ever end."

For more on Young's incredible journey, pick up the latest issue of PEOPLE, on newsstands Friday!
td_rationale: Based on the detailed personal journey described in the message, including specific details such as her early life in foster care, adoption, career struggles, and eventual breakthrough in Hollywood, the message appears to be more likely a real account rather than fictional. The designer's father, Earl F. Brosnahan, Jr., passed away at the age of 89, leaving his heartbroken daughter to mourn his loss.

Actress Rachel Brosnahan, Kate's granddaughter, paid tribute to her grandfather in an Instagram post, describing him as a man of few words, but when he spoke, the whole room would listen. The heartbreak of a political divide has shattered the love affair of a celebrity couple. The British actor Michael Sheen and the comedian Sarah Silverman, known for their shared anti-populist views, have called it quits after four years of being in a relationship. According to Sheen, their passion for politics was what ultimately led to their separation.

Sheen, who has previously compared the rise of populism to the rise of Nazism in Germany in the '30s, told the Daily Telegraph that the Brexit referendum was what inspired him to become more politically active. However, their desire to make a difference in the world led them to take different paths. Silverman, an American, wanted to spend more time in America engaged in her I Love You, America project, which challenges Trumpism, while Sheen, a Welshman, wanted to be engaged in anti-Brexit campaigns in the U.K.

"We both had very similar drives, and yet to act on those drives pulled us in different directions—because she is American and I’m Welsh," Sheen explained. "After the Brexit vote, and the election where Trump became president, we both felt in different ways we wanted to get more involved. That led to her doing her show I Love You, America, and it led to me wanting to address the issues that I thought led some people to vote the way they did about Brexit, in the area I come from and others like it."

Despite the difficult decision to part ways, both Sheen and Silverman acknowledge that each of them had to do what they needed to do. Sheen has since been working with a range of grassroots groups in his hometown in Wales, aiming to combat inequality, which includes supporting credit unions and paying for research into ways of funding local journalism.

As the Telegraph puts it, "Sheen sounds a little wistful" about the impact that politics had on his love life. The emotional weight of this political divide has once again reminded us that love and politics are not mutually exclusive, but sometimes they can pull us in opposite directions.
td_rationale:
Based on the detailed description provided, the message appears to be a real account of the relationship between Michael Sheen and Sarah Silverman. It discusses their breakup attributed to their divergent political involvements following events like Brexit and Trump's election. The specific details, including Sheen's and Silverman's political activities and their geographical preferences (America vs. Wales), lend credibility to the narrative. Therefore, the message is more likely to be real.

**Prediction: 1**

EXCLUSIVE: Grey's Anatomy Spin-Off Title Revealed - Get Ready for Station 19!

The highly anticipated Grey's Anatomy spin-off has finally revealed its title - and it's a doozy! Series executive producer Paris Barclay announced the title on Twitter on Thursday, and fans couldn't contain their excitement. "Welcome all of them to @STATION19 #greysanatomy spin-off," Barclay wrote.

Station 19 is set to hit screens in March, and it promises to be a thrilling ride. The series will be set at Seattle Fire Station 19, in the same universe as Grey's Anatomy. Dr. Ben Warren, played by Jason George, will give up his life as a surgeon to become a firefighter. With his new firehouse just blocks away from Grey Sloan Memorial, there's sure to be plenty of opportunities for characters to crossover between the two shows.

Producers have been considering a few options for the show's title, but they ultimately settled on Station 19. ABC Entertainment president Channing Dungey admits that coming up with a title is one of the most challenging things they do, but he's confident they've chosen the perfect one.

"We really want to make sure that what we settle on is perfect," Dungey said.

Station 19, which falls under Shonda Rhimes' Shondaland banner, stars George, Jaina Lee Ortiz, Grey Damon, Barrett Doss, Alberto Frezza, Jay Hayden, Okieriete Onaodowan, Danielle Savre, and Miguel Sandoval. Ortiz also announced the title on Twitter, along with a bonus video from the cast.

Station 19 will premiere with a special two-hour event on ABC on March 22 before taking its usual "TGIT" time slot of 9 p.m. on March 29. Get ready for Station 19 - the spin-off of the century!

But as the family sat down to enjoy their birthday lunch, there was one missing face - that of Brooklyn, the eldest Beckham son. As the seconds ticked by, the family began to worry, their hearts heavy with worry and longing.

But just as they were about to give up hope, Brooklyn walked through the door, a smile on his face and a spring in his step. His father, the former Real Madrid star, couldn't believe his eyes as he teared up with emotion. The two men, who had been apart for far too long, embraced tightly, as if they had never been apart.

Victoria Beckham captured the emotional moment on camera and posted it to Instagram, where it has since been viewed by millions. The video is a testament to the power of family and the strength of love, a reminder that no distance can ever truly separate the heart.

Brooklyn, 19, has been making a name for himself in the fashion industry, modeling in New York City and attending college. On his birthday, he posted a photo of himself at the new Nordstrom men's store in midtown, looking stylish and confident.

Throughout the day, David Beckham posted updates on Instagram, showing off the heartfelt gifts his family had given him. Romeo, 15, wrote a card that simply said, "You are the best dad in the world! I hope you have the best day!" Cruz, 13, gave his dad a card with a giant gorilla on it, the words "Dad, you the man" spelled out in bold letters. Harper Seven, 6, gave her dad a key chain with the words "Daddy's wine cellar. Love Harper! XOXO" etched on it.

As the day wore on, Brooklyn posted a photo of his dad enjoying a glass of red wine, looking relaxed and happy. It was a simple moment, but one that spoke to the deep love and bond that exists between the Beckham family.

On this special day, we celebrate David Beckham and all that he has accomplished in his life. But more than anything, we celebrate the love and joy that he has brought into the world through his family. Happy birthday, David Beckham. You are loved and celebrated by so many.

[The LGBTQ+ community continues to inspire and empower one another, as pop culture icons continue to celebrate Pride Month in their own special way.

Musician Jason Mraz, in particular, has written a heartfelt love poem to the community titled "I Am Bi Your Side," published by Billboard for its "Love Letter to the LGBTQ Community" feature on Thursday.

"Dear You,

Thank you.

You have shown me what love is.

You have given me hope.

You have given me strength.

You have taught me what it means to be brave.

You have fought for me.

You have fought for the world.

And now the world is a better place because of you.

We still have a long way to go

But know

I am bi your side.

All ways.

Jason Mraz"

Mraz has always been an advocate for the LGBTQ+ community, even before he came out himself. In 2011, during his engagement to Tristan Prettyman, the couple vowed to not marry until gay marriage became legal. He was also the first-ever straight man on the cover of Instinct magazine in 2012, recognized for his efforts in support of LGBTQ rights.

Mraz eventually married his girlfriend, Christina Carano, in October 2015, once same-sex marriage became legal in the U.S.

On Thursday, the actor from Waitress also released his new single, "Unlonely," which will be featured on his upcoming album, Know, set to be released on Aug.10.

For more on Mraz and his advocacy for the LGBTQ+ community, watch below.

The man who brought us some of Hollywood's biggest films, Harvey Weinstein, has caused a stir with his latest move. The producer has apologized for using statements by Meryl Streep and Jennifer Lawrence in an attempt to dismiss a class action sexual misconduct lawsuit against him. Six women are suing Weinstein and what they call the "Weinstein Sexual Enterprise," which they say includes his brother Bob and their co-founded studio The Weinstein Company. They allege that they conspired to conceal Weinstein's widespread alleged sexual harassment.

The plaintiffs argue that, due to the scale of sexual misconduct allegations against Weinstein, his "sexual enterprise" should be considered an organized crime group. Lawyers for the Hollywood mogul filed a motion to dismiss the suit on Tuesday, arguing that it was "fatally overboard" and would apply to "all women who ever met with Weinstein, regardless of whether they claimed to have suffered any identifiable harm."

They pointed to statements from Streep and Lawrence, who have both spoken out against the motion filed by Weinstein's lawyers. Streep has described the producer as a "predator," while Lawrence has said that she stands behind the women who have survived his abuse and wants him to be brought to justice.

A spokesperson for Weinstein said that he has directed his counsel to not use specific names by actors who have made previous public statements about him. He has also apologized for any pain or suffering caused by his actions.

The motion filed by Weinstein's lawyers has been met with criticism from Streep and Lawrence, who both believe that it is a desperate attempt to avoid accountability. The women in the lawsuit argue that the statute of limitations on the allegations does not apply because the alleged victims were under duress not to make the claims earlier.

Weinstein has been accused of sexual harassment and assault by dozens of women. He denies all allegations of non-consensual sex. The world is watching as this story unfolds, and many are hoping that justice will be served.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed description provided, the message appears to be describing real events and developments involving Harvey Weinstein, Meryl Streep, Jennifer Lawrence, and a class action sexual misconduct lawsuit against Weinstein and his company. The allegations, legal motions, public statements from involved parties, and the overall context are specific and coherent, suggesting it reflects actual news reporting rather than fictional content. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.

George Clooney has spoken publicly about his experience of becoming a father to twins, revealing details of their birth and denying that he and his wife Amal used fertility drugs to become pregnant.

In an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, the Suburbicon director explained that the couple never discussed children while they were dating and didn't bring it up until after their 2014 wedding. He stated that becoming a parent had never been part of his DNA and that they didn't plan on it.

Clooney and Amal became pregnant in 2016, and he was with her in London when they went to the doctor for an ultrasound. When the doctor told them there were two fetuses, Clooney was surprised and kept thinking there was a mistake. The couple welcomed Alexander and Ella on June 6, a month premature, at St. Mary's Hospital, where Prince William and Kate Middleton's children were born. Alexander was born one minute and 49 seconds before Ella, and Clooney revealed that Alexander weighed five and a half pounds, while Ella weighed four and a half pounds. The twins have dual British and American nationality.

Clooney, who is 56, described his reaction to the birth as "wild." He added that becoming a parent was a sudden realization, and he wanted his children to be happy, have a sense of humor, and be interested in things.

While Clooney admitted that both parents are "unrested" in their new role, he was surprised to find that he was good at changing diapers. He also denied that the couple used fertility drugs to become pregnant, despite speculation that this may have arisen due to Amal's age and the multiple births.

In other news, Clooney is promoting his new film, Suburbicon, a drama set in the late 1950s that he directed and co-wrote with Grant Heslov, starring Matt Damon and Julianne Moore. The Paramount release debuted at the Venice Film Festival on Saturday.
