Are you tired of wearing uncomfortable jeans on your next trip? Look no further than these top picks for the best jeans for travel. From denim that's guaranteed to always fit to fleece-lined skinnies, we've got you covered.

Mott & Bow's Slim Grand Jeans are made from a premium 100 percent organic cotton fabric that's hypoallergenic and free from chemicals. The heavyweight fabric offers just the right amount of stretch to be comfortable without being saggy.

Hue's Denim Jeggings are the perfect combination of jeans and leggings. They look and feel like jeans, but offer all the comfort of leggings. The pull-on pants add to the jeans illusion with functional back pockets, faux front pockets, a faux fly, and brushed gold hardware.

L.L. Bean's Fleece-Lined Jeans are perfect for cold-weather destinations. The thin but cozy fleece interior will keep you warm while looking good. The premium stretch denim utilizes the trademarked S Gene technology, which helps the fabric retain its shape through every wear.

Mott & Bow's Slim Boyfriend Ridge Jeans are among the brand's stretchiest, with 23 percent elasticity. The modern fit style is slim without being too skinny and comes in various washes to suit every style.

1822 Denim Butter Bootcut Jeans are made from a fabric so soft that it's called "butter." The ultra-stretchy jeans feel more like jeggings than traditional denim and have five pockets for added convenience.

Spanx's Straight Leg Jeans are perfect for those who hate the feeling of a waistband digging in. The stretchy elastic band in lieu of a button or zippers is comfortable and functional. These normal-looking jeans are equipped with hidden "core-shaping and rear-lifting" technology.

Levi Strauss's pull-on skinny jeans are a cheaper option and come in a wide variety of lengths, sizes, and colors. The jeans feature built-in shapewear and functional pockets.

Everlane's The Original Cheeky Jean is made from an organic cotton and stretch yarn blend and is sustainable. The high rise is nearly 12 inches and the pants are perfect for plus-size travelers.

The Fever High Waist Stash Pocket Jeans boast two snap-closed flap pockets that can conceal your valuables. The soft and stretchy denim pants move with you instead of restricting and are designed to fit perfectly on your next trip.

Good American's Always Fits jeans are so stretchy that they're guaranteed to adapt up to four sizes for the perfect fit, even if you're on a round-the-world trip. These are perfect for plus-size travelers, offering options from size 00 to 32 Plus.

Travel smarter and upgrade your denim game with these top picks for the best jeans for travel.

Chris Evans and Jenny Slate have once again called it quits, according to a sensational report by the New York Times. The couple's on-again, off-again relationship has been the subject of tabloid headlines and social media chatter, but the details of what caused the latest breakup remain unclear.

INSIDER spoke with relationship experts to get to the bottom of why getting back together with an ex is almost always a bad idea. According to April Masini, a relationship expert and online advice forum host, the couple's pattern of breaking up and getting back together is a bad behavioral pattern that can become a source of strain in their daily lives. "Drama replaces problem solving and breakups become a very disruptive part of the relationship dynamic," Masini said.

Susan Winter, another relationship expert and best-selling author, added that reuniting with an ex is typically not worthwhile unless values, priorities, or the person in general has significantly shifted. "Unless values, priorities, or the person in general has significantly shifted, restarting an ended relationship is typically not worthwhile," Winter said. "In this case, the issues that appeared to exist (differences in levels of fame and insecurities) didn't change. Love can't conquer everything."

Rachel DeAlto, another relationship expert, agreed that getting back together with an ex is often more trouble than it's worth. "Unless values, priorities, or the person in general has significantly shifted, restarting an ended relationship is typically not worthwhile," DeAlto said. "In this case, the issues that appeared to exist (differences in levels of fame and insecurities) didn't change. Love can't conquer everything."

Despite these experts' advice, it's possible that Evans and Slate may be following the same line of thinking that has led to their previous breakups. "They're a great odd couple, and Hollywood loves an odd couple romance," Masini said. "And they're not insusceptible to what fans love to see, which makes their issues even tougher."

The good news is that breakups can often lead to positive change. "A breakup can be an enormous motivator to improve ourselves," Winter said. "The clients that come to me and tell me they've lost somebody they love are so incredibly motivated to correct and change things about themselves and their personality."

Whether Evans and Slate will heed this advice remains to be seen, but one thing is for sure: getting back together with an ex is rarely the solution to relationship problems.

EXCLUSIVE: PRINCESS DIANA'S SONS OPEN UP ON TRAGIC DEATH IN NEW DOCUMENTARY!

Two of the most important figures in the life of the late Princess Diana are finally speaking out about her tragic death in a new, sensational documentary set to air on NBC. Prince William, Duke of Cambridge, and Prince Harry will sit down on camera to discuss the days following their mother's death in a two hour examination of the tumultuous week.

“Diana, 7 Days” is set to air in September to mark the 20 year anniversary of her death and will delve into how it impacted her sons and the role they played in helping their country mourn in the aftermath. The documentary promises to be an emotional and revealing look at the life of the late princess and the impact she had on those around her.

Prince William said in a statement released by the network, “Part of the reason why Harry and I want to do this is because we feel we owe it to her. We couldn’t protect her, and we want to remind people of the character and person that she was.”

Prince Harry echoed those sentiments, saying, “When she died there was such an outpour of emotion and love which was quite shocking. It was beautiful at the same time, and it was amazing now looking back at it. It was amazing that our mother had such a huge effect on so many people. When you’re that young and something like that happens to you, I think it’s lodged in here, there, wherever – in your heart, in your head and it stays there for a very, very long time. I think it’s never going to be easy for the two of us to talk about our mother, but 20 years on seems like a good time to remind people of the difference that she made, not just to the Royal Family but also to the world.”

The documentary will also feature interviews with family, close friends, political figures, and journalists, providing a comprehensive look at the life and legacy of Princess Diana. Don't miss this exclusive, emotional and revealing look at the life of the late princess and the impact she had on those around her.

On Saturday, March 4, the Southern California Monitoring Association's Twitter account posted that police received a call about a prowler who was allegedly shot at a house believed to belong to reality star Kim Kardashian. The scanner and radio monitoring club's account claimed there was a home invasion and a maid was shot by an unnamed suspect at Kardashian's home. However, the Southern California Monitoring Association later tweeted that the caller disconnected as authorities entered the home, confirming that the call was a false alarm.

The Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) initially told Us Weekly that there was no crime, but later clarified to Us that they did not respond to any call like this on that day. Kim Kardashian's representative also told Us Weekly that the Keeping Up With the Kardashians star was not swatted, and any police calls made on that day had "nothing to do with Kim."

Kris Jenner, Kim Kardashian's mother and a previous victim of swatting calls, tweeted in 2013, "These prank calls are NOT funny! People can get arrested for this! I hope they find out who is behind this. Its dangerous & not a joke!" Swatting calls are hoaxes in which police are deceived and called to a location under false pretenses.

Previous victims of swatting calls include Lil Wayne, Ashton Kutcher, and Justin Bieber.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed investigation and statements from reliable sources such as the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD), Kim Kardashian's representative, and the Southern California Monitoring Association, it is highly likely that the initial message about the incident involving Kim Kardashian was not accurate. The Southern California Monitoring Association later confirmed that the call was a false alarm, the LAPD denied responding to any such incident, and Kardashian's representative stated she was not involved. Moreover, the concept of swatting, as described by Kris Jenner, aligns with the characteristics of the incident described. Therefore, the veracity of the initial message is likely to be 0, indicating it was not a real incident.
cs_rationale: Based on the conflicting information provided by the Southern California Monitoring Association, the LAPD, and Kim Kardashian's representative, as well as the history of swatting calls towards celebrities, it is more likely that the initial message about a shooting at Kim Kardashian's house was a false alarm. The lack of confirmation from official sources and the pattern of similar incidents involving other celebrities suggest that this message is not likely to be real. Therefore, the veracity of the message is likely to be 0.

On Wednesday, celebrated television host Ellen DeGeneres and actress Portia de Rossi celebrated their ninth wedding anniversary. To mark the occasion, DeGeneres shared a photograph of the pair on their wedding day on Instagram, captioning it simply, "@PortiadeRossi and I got married 9 years ago today. Being her wife is the greatest thing I am." Singer Joshua Radin, who performed at the wedding, also took to Instagram to celebrate the union, writing, "Nine years ago today, these two incredible women got married and asked me to sing some of my songs to them while they were celebrating their most special day. It’s still one of the most fun things I’ve ever done. Happy anniversary @theellenshow and @portiaderossi."

In an interview with Oprah Winfrey, de Rossi recalled how she fell for DeGeneres. "We actually met socially and I just felt that immediate draw," she said. "We did talk a little bit and then over those three years, we saw each other at parties or at various things, but the one time that was the most significant was during a photoshoot actually." She continued, "I just walked over to say hello to her, and I couldn’t believe it, but she turned around and it was like an arrow was shot through my heart. I felt weak at the knees and I was overwhelmed with how I felt, but then it took me about 10 months to get the courage up to actually do anything about it." The couple first announced their plans to marry in a 2008 episode of DeGeneres' talk show, following the news that the California Supreme Court had struck down a law banning same-sex marriage. They tied the knot in an intimate ceremony in their Los Angeles home in August of that year.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, it seems likely to be a real message rather than fabricated. The details include specific events (Ellen DeGeneres and Portia de Rossi celebrating their ninth wedding anniversary), references to social media posts (Ellen sharing a wedding day photograph on Instagram, Joshua Radin's Instagram post), and a recounting of personal moments (Portia de Rossi recalling how she fell for Ellen during a photoshoot and their marriage announcement on Ellen's talk show). These elements suggest a coherent narrative with specific details that are typical of real-life events rather than fabricated stories. Therefore, the veracity prediction would be 1.

The internet is a vast and ever-changing place, full of moments that capture the attention of millions and become a part of our collective consciousness. From the dress that divided the world to the "hot felon" who became a global sensation, these are the moments that broke the internet in a way that no other could.

The dress that divided the world

On February 26, 2015, a tweet featuring a close-up photo of a dress went viral, sparking a heated debate about its color. The dress was actually a blue and black bandage dress from British retailer Roman Originals, but people saw it as gold and white or blue and black. The debate raged on for days, with 7.6 million tweets and a surge in traffic to Roman Originals' site. The retailer sold out of the original black and gold dress in 34 minutes and eventually sold a white and gold version in support of British charity Comic Relief.

April the Giraffe's birth

In the spring of 2017, all eyes were on April, a pregnant giraffe at Animal Adventure Park in Harpursville, New York. The live-streaming camera set up in April's habitat captivated viewers as she gave birth to calf Tajiri on April 15, 2017. The live stream garnered more than 232 million live views on YouTube over a seven-week period.

The "yanny" or "laurel" debate

In May 2018, a bizarre recording of the word "laurel" split the internet in two. While some heard the word "laurel," others clearly heard "yanny," and nobody could agree on who was right. The audio clip was from an online dictionary entry, and the differing interpretations of the clip all had to do with how the brain interprets sound frequencies.

Jeremy Meeks, the "hot felon"

In June 2014, the Stockton Police Department released a mugshot of Jeremy Meeks, a 30-year-old inmate arrested on a weapons charge. Meeks' chiseled jaw and piercing eyes quickly made him a global sensation, and he was dubbed the "hot felon." Meeks signed to a modeling agency and has since worked around the world.

Beyoncé's pregnancy announcement

When Beyoncé makes an announcement, the world stops to listen, and her early morning pregnancy announcement was no different. Pregnant with twins, Queen Beyoncé posted a photo to Instagram in the wee hours of February 1, 2017, announcing that the Carter-Knowles family was "blessed two times over" and would be growing their family by two. The announcement post earned more than 11 million likes, making it one of the most-liked Instagram posts of all time.

Trump's "covfefe" tweet

On May 31, 2017, President Trump tweeted, "Despite the constant negative press covfefe." A screenshot of the now-deleted tweet shows Trump's use of "covfefe" in an apparent typo. The word became a catchphrase of sorts that spawned T-shirts, hashtags, and even a license plate. The baffling term even lent its name to a legislative proposal from U.S. Rep Mike Quigley. If enacted, the COVFEFE Act (Communications Over Various Feeds Electronically for Engagement Act) would have required the National Archives to keep records of the president's tweets.

Kim Kardashian's Paper magazine cover

In 2017, Kim Kardashian's bare-all cover of Paper magazine brought the phrase "break the internet" into the public lexicon. The magazine unveiled two covers shot by Jean-Paul Goude that feature the reality star, including one where she bares all. In the second photo, a recreation Goude's "Champagne Incident" photograph from the 1960s, Kardashian is popping open a bottle of champagne that has fountained over her head and into a glass balanced on her derriere.

Dwyane Wade, the star of the Miami Heat, has become one of the most highly paid basketball players in the world. With estimated net worths of over $100 million, it's hard to imagine the amount of hard work and dedication that has gone into his success.

But what exactly does Wade make his money from? The answer is simple: basketball and massive paychecks. Since joining the NBA in 2003-2004, Wade has made over $136 million playing the game he loves. His current contract pays him $15 million this season, with another $16.1 million due next season if he opts-in to his player option.

But Wade's success doesn't stop there. Along with LeBron James, Wade has mastered the art of taking short-term contracts to increase his flexibility and secure larger annual contracts. In 2014, he signed a two-year, $31.1 million contract with a player option, setting him up to be a free agent when the salary cap increases in 2016-2017. And when that time comes, Wade will be set to cash in on the biggest paydays of his career.

However, even with all of his accomplishments, Wade was only the 21st highest-paid player in the NBA last year, according to ESPN. He made far less than players like Joe Johnson, Rudy Gay, and Brook Lopez. But that's not reason to feel bad for Wade, though. He's made tens of millions more in sponsorship deals, including a high-profile deal with a sports brand in China.

Over the years, Wade has had sponsorship deals with Converse and Nike, but his biggest deal was with Chinese shoe company Li Ning. In 2012, he signed a 10-year deal with the company that few consumers know in the U.S., but which will pay him millions annually along with a reported $60 million stake in the company. It was a high-risk move for both Li Ning and Wade, and it's uncertain if it's paying off. Li Ning just reported its third straight year of losses, and its stock has gone almost nowhere since Wade signed the deal.

On top of Li Ning, Wade has had slightly less lucrative deals with Gatorade, Pepperidge Farm, Mission, and other brands. In total, Forbes estimates that he made $12 million in sponsorships last year.

Add it all up, and Dwyane Wade has made well over $200 million in his career. But after paying agents, managers, and living expenses, his net worth is likely significantly less than that. Estimates of his net worth are between $95 million and $115 million, and he has millions more coming in future years.

No matter how you look at it, Dwyane Wade has built a huge net worth and he'll likely add to it in years to come. And for those who have followed his career, it's clear that his success is a testament to his hard work, dedication, and willingness to take risks.

Drew Scott, the beloved star of TLC's "The Property Brothers," has officially tied the knot with his partner, Scott Brothers Global creative director Linda Phan. The couple exchanged vows in a breathtaking outdoor ceremony on the Italian coast, surrounded by 300 guests from all corners of the world.

The newlyweds, who have been together for years, described their wedding day as the most magical moment of their lives. They were overjoyed to be surrounded by loved ones in a beautiful setting, and expressed their gratitude for the countless blessings that had come their way.

The week-long celebration began with bachelor and bachelorette excursions, including a bicycle tour and cooking classes. The festivities culminated in a stunning Apulian-style welcome party, complete with artisan booths and delicious food.

Drew and Linda's wedding was a true reflection of their personalities and shared love for adventure. They exchanged custom wedding bands and were dressed in kilts by Claymore Imports. The ceremony was designed by Oany Ravelo, and the reception was held in a stunning outdoor venue.

For their first dance, the couple surprised guests with a choreographed routine by their "Dancing with the Stars" partner, Emma Slater. The wedding party included Drew's brothers, Jonathan and J.D., who served as the best men, and Linda had 10 bridesmaids.

In lieu of a registry, Drew and Linda partnered with the non-profit ME to WE to tie their wedding with their passion for providing clean water to people in need around the world. They gifted each of their 300 guests with travel bags designed by Lug, as well as custom pizza cutters and plates created by Fortessa, the manufacturer of their Scott Living line.

Drew and Linda's wedding was a true celebration of love and compassion. They can't wait to see what the future holds for them and expressed their excitement for the next chapter of their lives. "I'm most looking forward to spending more time together," Drew said. "We've been working so hard for so long, I'm looking forward to making plans to settle down and just enjoy doing nothing once in a while."

"Property Brothers: Linda & Drew Say I Do" will premiere on June 2 at 9/8c on TLC. For more details and photos from the wedding, pick up the issue of PEOPLE on newsstands on May 18, and watch PeopleTV's exclusive special, "People Weddings: Drew Scott and Linda Phan," on Wednesday, May 16 on PeopleTV.com or download the app on your favorite mobile or connected device.

On a warm February day, I visited Georgina Chapman's West Village townhouse to interview her. Upon arrival, I discovered that the parlor floor, despite the unseasonable heat outside, was warmed by a roaring fire. As I waited, I realized that I was sitting in Harvey Weinstein's living room. He had purchased the six-story house in 2006, before marrying Chapman, and she had since transformed it with her style. The black floors and white rugs, chinoiserie, gilt, and glass, hydrangeas in a vase, and a Jo Malone candle completed the ambiance.

A few weeks earlier, I had met Chapman at the Marchesa fashion company atelier, where she co-owns the business with Keren Craig. She appeared nervous and uncomfortable, mentioning that she had not been out in public for five months since similar accusations against her husband were made public. Today, she was more relaxed, though there was a sense of gallows humor. When I mentioned the warm weather, she quipped, "Think of all the poor plants that are going to spring out and then die."

We moved downstairs to the ground floor, which was a large, open space with modern furniture and surprising art. There was a spacious kitchen that overlooked the backyard, and a TV room where Chapman's son Dash was sitting on a sectional encircled by some kind of electronic device. At 42, Chapman looked younger than in photographs, perhaps because she was more goofy than I had imagined. Although she retained her British accent, she was more laid-back than I had expected.

Our meeting took place in Chapman's soon-to-be-ex-townhouse that had recently been sold by her soon-to-be-ex-husband. It was meant to be the first time she publicly addressed what happened with her husband. However, the night before our meeting, she called me late and sounded worried, apologetic, and unsure of whether she was ready to address difficult questions. I reassured her that we could discuss topics unrelated to her marriage to Weinstein. During our meeting, we primarily discussed her life before her marriage to Weinstein and her fashion company Marchesa.
td_rationale: Given the specific details and descriptions provided in the message, it appears to be a real, firsthand account of the author's visit to Georgina Chapman's townhouse and their meeting with her. The vivid descriptions of the interior of the townhouse, the interactions with Chapman, and the specific references to her personal life and business suggest that the message is more likely to be real. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.
cs_rationale: Given the level of detail and specificity in the message, it is more likely to be a real account. Leonardo DiCaprio Joins Forces with Celebrities to Donate $1 Million to Hurricane Harvey Relief Efforts

In a stunning show of generosity, Leonardo DiCaprio has joined the ranks of other celebrities who have donated to the Hurricane Harvey relief efforts. The Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation has donated a whopping $1 million to the newly established United Way Harvey Recovery Fund, which will be used to support short and long-term relief and recovery efforts for those affected by the devastating hurricane.

This generous donation from the Oscar-winning actor and his foundation marks the inaugural contribution to the fund and is the latest in a series of disaster relief efforts supported by the DiCaprio Foundation. In the past, the foundation has donated to recovery efforts following the 2004 tsunami, the Haiti earthquake, and Hurricane Sandy.

"We are incredibly grateful for the generosity of Leonardo DiCaprio and his foundation," said United Way Worldwide President and CEO Brian Gallagher in a statement. "Responding to Hurricane Harvey requires the best of all of us - and that's what this gift represents."

United Way is the world's largest privately-funded non-profit organization and anticipates that Harvey recovery efforts will take several years. The $1 million donation from DiCaprio's foundation will be used to support these efforts.

Many other celebrities have also stepped up to help out, including Sandra Bullock, who donated $1 million to the American Red Cross on Tuesday. Beyonce, Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, DJ Khaled, and Kevin Hart have also donated to the cause. Johnson, Khaled, and Hart each donated $25,000 to Harvey relief, with Kevin Hart challenging other celebrities to do the same.

If you would like to help out, you can do so by donating to the United Way Harvey Recovery Fund or by volunteering your time to support the relief efforts in any way you can.

Based on the provided message, it appears to be a real and verifiable news article rather than fictitious or misleading information. The statement from United Way's President further supports the authenticity of DiCaprio's donation. Therefore, the message is likely to be real.

content:
Celine Dion Returns to the Stage in Las Vegas Just Days After Mass Shooting

In a heartwarming and emotional move, legendary singer Celine Dion took to the stage in Las Vegas on Tuesday night, just two days after the city and the country were left reeling from the deadliest mass shooting in modern American history.

Dion, who has two long-running residencies in Vegas, made a poignant statement ahead of her show, saying that proceeds from the night would go to the victims of Sunday's shooting at the Route 91 Harvest Festival and their families.

“Tonight is very different,” Dion said, according to videos taken by fans. “After Sunday night’s incredibly tragic event, all of us here find ourselves asking a similar question. For you, it’s, ‘Do we still go to Celine’s show on Tuesday night, only two days after the nightmare?’ For me, it’s, ‘Can I still do my show? Should I still do my show only two days after the nightmare?’ These are difficult questions.”

Despite the emotional weight of the situation, Dion ultimately decided to go on with her performances “to show love and support for those who are affected.”

“On Sunday, we lost too many beautiful, innocent souls and so many are still suffering. But tonight, we are going to let these families know that we are supporting them and that we will help them through their tragic loss,” she said. “They are going to need a lot of love, a ton of emotional support, as well as a great deal of financial aid.”

Her announcement that proceeds would be donated drew more than 30 seconds of applause from the crowd.

Dion also dedicated the show to the victims, their families, first responders, and doctors and nurses “who are working around the clock to save lives.”

“I want you to know that you have made the right choice in being here tonight,” she said.

In the aftermath of Sunday's shooting, which killed 58 and injured more than 500, fellow Vegas-based performer Jennifer Lopez canceled her shows through October 7, according to a statement obtained by Variety.

Jason Aldean, who was on stage when the shooting began, also canceled his shows through October 12.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific account provided in the message, including quotes attributed to Celine Dion and mentions of actions taken by other performers such as Jennifer Lopez and Jason Aldean, the message appears to be more likely to be a real account rather than fabricated. The inclusion of specific details like the dedication of proceeds, reactions from the audience, and comparisons to other performers' responses adds credibility to the narrative. Therefore, I would predict the veracity of the message as 1 (real message).

Celine Dion's return to the in Las Vegas just days after the mass shooting seems to be a real and credible event, multiple sources have reported on it, including statements from fans and media outlets. The weight of the situation and her decision to continue with her performances despite the tragedy demonstrates a sense of support for those affected by the shooting. Therefore, based on these details, it is more likely that this message is real.

Nicolette Kloe Robinson, an American stage and television actress, has left us all heartbroken. She was a shining light in the world, and her loss is immeasurable.

Born on April 18, 1988 in Los Angeles, California, Robinson was the daughter of a Jewish mother and an African-American father. She grew up with a diverse and loving family, which she often joked looked like the United Nations.

Despite the challenges she faced, Robinson pursued her dreams, majoring in musical theater at the University of California, Los Angeles. She performed in multiple stage productions and received numerous accolades, including the Gant Gaither Theater Award from the Princess Grace Foundation-USA and a scholarship from the Jackie Robinson Foundation.

In 2012, Robinson married actor Leslie Odom Jr., whom she met in 2008 while auditioning for a role in the musical Once on This Island in Los Angeles. The two were meant to be, and their love story was a testament to the power of true love. They welcomed their first child, a daughter named Lucille Ruby, on April 23, 2017, and their son, Able Phineas, on March 25, 2021.

Throughout her career, Robinson graced the stages of Broadway and television with her incredible talent. She will always be remembered for her roles in The Affair and Waitress, but her impact on the world will never be forgotten.

Rest in peace, Nicolette Kloe Robinson. You will be deeply missed.

Jennifer Holliday, a Tony-winning Broadway star, has announced that she will no longer be participating in the presidential inauguration celebration next week. Her decision comes after backlash from her fans, who felt that her participation would be interpreted as a statement of support for President-elect Donald Trump.

Holliday, best known for her role in the hit musical "Dreamgirls," faced pressure from the gay, lesbian, and black communities when it was announced that she would sing at a concert on Thursday at Washington's Lincoln Memorial. In a statement released on Saturday, she apologized for her lapse of judgment and for any heartbreak she may have caused to her fans.

Several other prominent entertainers have also declined to perform at Trump's inauguration festivities. Country star Toby Keith and actor Jon Voight are among those who have agreed to participate in the concert.

Holliday's decision to withdraw from the event was first reported by The Wrap, which obtained a letter that she wrote to her fans. Her representative, Bill Carpenter, confirmed the details in the letter to the Associated Press.

In the letter, Holliday wrote, "My only choice must now be to stand with the LGBT Community and to state unequivocally that I WILL NOT PERFORM FOR THE WELCOME CONCERT OR FOR ANY OF THE INAUGURATION FESTIVITIES!" She added, "Please know that I HEAR YOU and I feel your pain. The LGBT Community was mostly responsible for birthing my career and I am deeply indebted to you."

Holliday had been scheduled to perform at the "Make America Great Again! Welcome Celebration," which also included Toby Keith and Jon Voight. The event is part of Trump's inauguration festivities, which will take place on Friday, January 20th.

content:
[April the giraffe is pregnant again! Get ready for the cutest baby giraffe of the year. (Photo: Animal Adventure Park)

After months of suspense and anticipation, Animal Adventure Park owner Jordan Patch finally revealed the big news: April the giraffe is expecting another baby calf.

Last month, the park sent 30 days worth of fecal samples to another zoo's laboratory for progesterone testing to confirm the pregnancy, 14 months after April gave birth to her calf, Tajiri.

Keeper Allysa Swilley collected a fecal sample from April's stall over the course of a month. The samples were secured in plastic bags, labeled and dated before being put in freezer storage.

April is months into her pregnancy and due to give birth in early spring 2019, park officials said.

Last year, Southern Tier residents and others from around the nation and world watched, captivated, as the heavily pregnant giraffe captivated audiences on the park's live stream during the final weeks of her pregnancy.

On April 15, 2017, more than a million viewers tuned in to watch April give birth to a healthy, male calf named Tajiri.

“April’s prior pregnancy facilitated an immeasurable amount of education and appreciation for giraffes," Patch said in a news release. "We’re very proud of our captive management and propagation program and eager to continue doing all we can to help bring this species awareness and tangible results towards conservation.”

Fans will once again be able to follow April's progress throughout her pregnancy on social media, the park said.

The Duchess of Cambridge, also known as Kate Middleton, is a member of the British royal family and has been married to Prince William since 2011. The couple has three children together.

Prince William is second in line to the throne after his father, Prince Charles. If Charles becomes King, both the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge will move up the line of succession. Prince William is expected to become the Prince of Wales and Kate will be styled as the Princess of Wales, a title that was last held by her late mother, Princess Diana.

When William takes the throne, Kate will become the Queen Consort, a title that has only been held by male consorts in the past. However, Kate will not be referred to as the Queen of England, and will only hold the title of Queen Consort. Princess Charlotte, who is fourth in line to the throne, has the potential to hold the title of Queen, if she is born before her older brother.

Kate Middleton's current title is Her Royal Highness the Duchess of Cambridge, a title that she assumes from her husband. When William becomes King, it is widely expected that Kate will assume the title of Queen Consort, but it is possible that she will be referred to as Queen or Queen Catherine.

The book reveals the scandalous relationship between Charles and Camilla Parker Bowles, which began after the death of Princess Diana.

Following Diana's tragic accident in 1997, Prince Charles proposed the idea of welcoming Bowles into the royal family, but Queen Elizabeth II was not pleased. According to Bower, the Queen referred to Bowles as "that wicked woman" and declared that she wanted "nothing to do with her." The Queen was reportedly upset by Charles' relationship with Bowles during his marriage to Diana and would not forgive Bowles for not leaving Charles alone to work on their marriage.

The Queen remained skeptical about the relationship for years, and it wasn't until 2005 that she gave her permission for Charles and Bowles to marry. Despite the Queen's initial disapproval, Bowles has slowly grown on her and she can now be seen standing alongside the royal family at public events and family outings. Taylor Swift's renditions of "Delicate" and "September" from Earth, Wind & Fire have left her fans in a state of turmoil. The acoustic versions, released in a Spotify Singles session on Friday morning, were met with a barrage of negative comments on social media, with Hollywood Life publishing a piece titled "Twitter Needs to Seriously Chill About Taylor Swift's 'September' Cover." Swift's版本与EWF的版本相比，显得更加平静，与原版的欢乐形成了鲜明的对比。

At the same time, reports emerged that the press release for the songs had been altered. The second and third sentences of this paragraph were removed: "Taylor says that she chose 'September' for sentimental reasons. She's always loved the classic tune by Earth, Wind & Fire, and notes that the month of September is especially meaningful to one of her relationships. An added layer of sentiment came from being able to record the song in a Nashville studio, the city Taylor moved at age 14 to pursue country music." Spin has speculated on the reasons behind the edit, as well as Swift's alteration of the date in the song's opening line, which she changes from Sept. 21 to Sept. 28.

Swift's comments on the other track remained unchanged in the press release: "Delicate' is a song about the vulnerability that immediately surfaces in all of us the minute we meet someone we want to like us," it reads. "We think about everything they might've heard about us, every reason they wouldn’t want us. Every step forward toward that other person scares us, but it thrills us too. 'Delicate' is about the balancing act of the rush and the fear and hoping it's really worth it to take that chance."

This isn't Swift's first foray into Spotify exclusives, as she released a "Delicate" vertical video in recent weeks. In 2014, Swift harshly criticized the service and removed her music from all streaming platforms over what she said were unfair royalty payments. She relented with Apple a few months later, and ultimately returned all of her albums to the major services in June of last year. Her latest album, "Reputation," was withheld from all streaming services until three weeks after its release last November.

Swift's "Reputation" stadium tour is set to launch on May 8 in Arizona.

Amy Adams was inadvertently named as a nominee for Best Actress for her role as linguist Louise Banks in Denis Villeneuve's sci-fi film "Arrival." This would have been her sixth Oscar nomination. She was originally considered a strong contender, but may have seen her support eroded by also being in contention for "Nocturnal Animals." The actual nominees were Isabelle Huppert for "Elle," Ruth Negga for "Loving," Natalie Portman for "Jackie," Emma Stone for "La La Land," and Meryl Streep for "Florence Foster Jenkins."

Annette Bening was incorrectly listed in the same category for the comedy-drama "20th Century Women." This would have been her fifth nomination.

Tom Hanks was listed incorrectly as a nominee for Best Actor for his role as Capt. Chesley Sullenberger in Clint Eastwood's biographic action-drama "Sully," about how Sullenberger successfully landed a disabled jet airplane on the Hudson River in 2009. This would have been Hanks' sixth nomination in the category, which he won for "Forrest Gump" and "Philadelphia." Hanks was viewed as a longshot for a nomination for "Sully," which was a box office success. I had just downed a few drinks and spotted her sitting at the table, and I couldn't resist the urge to go say hi. "Rihanna's over there, let me go say hi, she knows me, we're homegirls," I mumbled around the 1:50 mark. And I approached her, only to tap her lightly on the shoulder. To my surprise, she was incredibly friendly and kind, and I was left speechless. "Hey girl, good to see you!" she said with a smile. My heart was pounding, and I stuttered, "Uh...oh...we're...uh..." and excused myself, unable to contain my excitement. I walked away, feeling like I had blown any chance of becoming her best friend, all because of my drunken nervousness and starstruck-ness.

This encounter will likely not be the last time our paths cross, as Rae is set to write and star in a Twitter-conceived heist film with Lupita Nyong'o and Rihanna. In the meantime, we share a commonality—both of us have been pursued by Drake. While Rihanna has made it clear she has no interest in the Toronto rapper, Rae once again stated she did not turn him down at the Golden Globes.

One night, as I was heading to the HBO party, Drake was leaving the HBO party. We crossed paths, and he said the most magical words ever. "I've been looking for you all night," he said. "You talking about me?" I asked, my heart racing. "I'm about to go to this Netflix party, do you want to go?" he replied. "Oh, I have to go, stop in the HBO party," I said, because they're the network that puts my show on. "I couldn't just ditch the party and go to Netflix party even though that's what I really wanted to do. So I said, 'I'll catch you at that party.' And that was it. I went to the party, and all of a sudden blogs were reporting that I turned him down, which would never happen.

Thankfully, that didn't stop me from appearing in Drake's "Nice for What" video alongside other famous women, which I called a "dream come true."

As for my critically-acclaimed HBO series Insecure, I told Colbert that my mom stopped watching after a few racy scenes in season 2. Season 3 is set to begin this Sunday at 10:30 p.m., and I'm sure there will be more scenes that will make my mom cringe.
td_rationale: The message seems to be a first-person account of an encounter with Rihanna and Drake. It contains specific details and emotions that make it sound like a real experience. Additionally, the mention of future and appearances in music videos adds credibility to the story. The writing style is conversational adding to its authenticity. Based on these observations, it is more likely that this message is a real account rather than fabricated. Therefore, I predict its veracity as 1.
cs_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific description of the encounter with Rihanna and the reference to other known events and appearances, the message is likely to be real. Predicted veracity: 1

"Moore's War on Yoga Pants: 'I Want Montana to Be Known as a Decent State!'"

In a shocking statement, controversial figure and Montana Governor, Greg Gianforte, has declared that yoga pants should be illegal in public. According to the Associated Press, Moore made the bold claim, "I want Montana to be known as a decent state."

Despite Moore's bizarre stance, the U.S. sales for yoga clothes have increased an astounding 45 percent year over year, while participation in yoga sports has only increased by a measly 4.5 percent. This means that more and more women are embracing athleisure wear as their go-to uniform, and for good reason - yoga pants are versatile, seasonless, and most importantly, comfortable.

But just because yoga pants are comfortable, doesn't mean they should be worn anywhere and everywhere. Here are some tips on how to wear yoga pants around town without getting the side-eye:

DO: Learn from Lululemon's sheer pants recall. Make sure you select a pair that is truly opaque. Test them out in broad daylight or under bright lights.

DON'T: Wear them to work. Ever. "Dress Pant Yoga Pants" is an oxymoron.

DO: Invest in the correct size. It sounds like a no-brainer, but often women will purchase a size down to get a tighter fit or a longer shelf life since yoga pants stretch out. In reality, all you end up with is "camel toe." Avoid at all costs.

DON'T: Show your panty lines. If thongs aren't your thing, Commando and Zobha make great full-coverage bikini bottoms that are undetectable.

DO: Layer up! Throwing on a leather jacket or a dark trench over your yoga pants and T-shirt will instantly dress up your look when you're running from bikram to brunch.

DON'T: Keep wearing your favorite pair after the expiration date. Unlike jeans, yoga pants don't age well. Toss them when they're overly faded, stretched or ripped.

DO: Accessorize! Nothing pulls together athleisure wear like a statement handbag and a pair of sunglasses.

DON'T: Try to pull off your zaniest tie-dye yoga pants outside your ashtanga class. Stock up on neutral colors — navy, black, charcoal — that will go with anything.

DO: Consider your tight-fitting yoga pants a thicker alternative to leggings in the wintertime. On the weekends, pair with knee-high boots and an oversized sweater, or wear them underneath a dress. No one will know the difference.

To shop the best yoga pants on the market, click on the slideshow below.
td_rationale: This message seems like a satirical or joking take on a hypothetical statement made by the Montana Governor, Greg Gianforte, about banning yoga pants in public. The message also provides tips on how to wear yoga pants without getting negative attention, but the overall tone suggests that it's a humorous exaggeration rather than a genuine declaration. Therefore, the veracity of this message is low, and it is more likely to be an exaggerated or satirical piece. Predicted veracity: 0
cs_rationale:
Based on the provided message, it appears to be satirical or fictional rather than a real news report. Several elements suggest this:

1. **Greg Gianforte as Governor**: While Greg Gianforte was indeed Governor of Montana, the extreme stance against yoga pants seems exaggerated and not aligned with typical political discourse.

2. **Bizarre and Extreme Claims**: The statement about wanting Montana to be known as a "decent state" due to banning yoga pants in public is highly unusual and provocative, which is often characteristic of satire or parody.

3. **Contradictory Sales and Participation Figures**: The statistics provided (45% increase in yoga clothes sales vs. 4.5% increase in yoga participation) seem oddly specific and not typically found in serious news reports. They also serve to exaggerate the scenario.

4. **Style and Tone**: The article's style, with tips on wearing yoga pants and a casual tone about athleisure wear, resembles lifestyle or fashion advice rather than serious political or societal commentary.

Therefore, considering these points, it's reasonable to conclude that the message is more likely to be fictional or satirical rather than a genuine news report. Hence, I predict its veracity as **0**.

The Mad Max: Fury Road star, Charlize Theron, is set to make a comeback with her new action film, Atomic Blonde. But little does she know, her career almost took a different turn. Following her Best Actress Oscar win for 2003’s Monster, Theron was offered plenty of roles in action movies, but none of them quite fit her desired image of a no-nonsense female assassin. That is, until she came across the opportunity to work with director Karyn Kusama on Aeon Flux.

“I got offered a lot of stuff in action movies that was either the girl behind the computer or the wife,” Theron revealed to Variety magazine. “When Aeon Flux came to me, I thought that could be something. I was never completely sold on the entire concept, but I really loved Karyn Kusama’s movie (Girlfight). So I threw myself into that with the belief that she’s a great filmmaker.”

Unfortunately, their collaboration did not yield the desired results. The film received a lukewarm reception from critics and failed to make a significant impact at the box office. “And then we f**ked it all up,” Theron joked. “I just don’t think we really knew how to execute it. LOS ANGELES (AP) — The legal team of Harvey Weinstein has filed a sensational motion to dismiss Ashley Judd's lawsuit against the disgraced movie mogul, accusing her of filing her sexual harassment allegations far too late and making baseless claims against him.

In a shocking move, Weinstein's lawyers argued that Judd's comment that she would only let Weinstein touch her after she won an Academy Award in one of his films was just a "mock bargain" she made in order to leave after he asked her for a massage in a Beverly Hills hotel room 22 years ago.

Judd's attorneys countered that the comment was just a "mock bargain" she made to leave the hotel room after Weinstein's inappropriate advances, but Weinstein's team claimed that it meant Judd acknowledged that Weinstein would try to get her movie roles.

The attorneys also argued that Judd's sexual harassment allegations, even if true, fall far short of being "unwelcome and pervasive or severe," as the law requires for a finding in her favor. They claimed that Weinstein's alleged unwanted sexual advances occurred on a single day and consisted of asking her to give him a massage, asking her to help him pick out clothes, and asking her to watch him shower.

In response to the motion to dismiss, Judd's attorney Theodore Boutrous Jr. said that "Mr. Weinstein's arguments seeking to escape the consequences of his despicable misconduct are not only baseless, they are offensive."

Judd, 50, was among the first women to go public with allegations against Weinstein, who faces criminal sexual assault charges in New York and has been named in several other sexual harassment lawsuits.

On Wednesday, newly-elected US Senator Kamala Harris met with nearly two dozen agriculture and water officials from the Central Valley to discuss ways to ensure a more reliable source of water for the region. The meeting was intended to ease the typically strained relationship between Democratic leaders from urban areas and the Republican-dominated Central Valley.

During the roundtable, Ryan Jacobsen, executive director of the Fresno County Farm Bureau, emphasized the need for federal and state action to protect the area's water supply. Jason Phillips, CEO of the Friant Water Authority, noted that recent rainfall had not solved the long-standing problem of nearly a decade of drought. He also mentioned that a canal that runs from Fresno to north of Bakersfield had sunk in some places as much as 2 feet in two years, causing issues with the system that operates on the force of gravity.

The meeting was also an opportunity for Harris to convince Central Valley representatives of her interest in issues beyond her base in Alameda and San Francisco counties. Harris is seeking to be more like Sen. Dianne Feinstein, who has worked for two decades to aid the agricultural industry. However, Harris' predecessor, former Sen. Barbara Boxer, was more aligned with environmental groups, which has led to a negative view of her in the Central Valley.

Some participants lobbied Harris for her support of dams that have long been under consideration by federal and state officials, particularly the Temperance Flat Dam, which would be constructed on the San Joaquin River. Harris offered no assurances on the topic, and speaking to reporters after the meeting, she said she would advocate for farmers during the crafting of a new farm bill and other measures before the Senate.

William Bourdeau, executive vice president of the influential Harris Farms, wished that Harris' urban supporters had a "better understanding" of the risks and challenges of farming. Harris replied that she agreed with him completely.

cs_rationale: Given the level of detail and the specifics of the discussions, it is highly likely that this message is real. Therefore, my prediction for its veracity is 1.

The stunt coordinator of the Kill Bill movies has come forward with shocking new allegations regarding a terrifying incident on set that left Uma Thurman injured. In an exclusive interview with The Hollywood Reporter, Keith Adams revealed that the entire stunt department was kept off set the day Thurman was allegedly pressured by director Quentin Tarantino to drive a vintage convertible at high speeds, resulting in a crash that left her with a concussion and damaged her knees.

“Ms. Thurman’s accident was not a stunt,” Adams emphatically stated in an email to THR. “No stunts were scheduled for that day, and no one from the stunt department was called to set. I was not consulted or notified about Ms. Thurman driving a car on camera that day.”

Adams, an experienced coordinator with a specialization in automotive work, added that if he had been involved, he would have insisted on using a professional driver and ensuring the car was road-worthy and safe. He did not specify whether he believed the stunt department was intentionally kept at bay to facilitate an actor performing dangerous driving maneuvers.

Thurman herself has described the 1973 Karmann Ghia as a "death box" and claimed that the incident was the result of a cover-up by production executives. The stunt coordinator's new statement underscores Thurman's account of the incident and highlights the dangers of allowing actors to perform dangerous driving stunts on set.

Many people share safety duties on set, including producers, directors, and the stunt coordinator. However, in this case, Adams admits that he did not have the opportunity to intervene when changes to the shoot were made, leaving the safety of the cast and crew at risk.

“On any set, my number one priority is the safety of the cast and crew,” Adams said. “Unfortunately, I did not have that opportunity in this case.”

This new revelation adds to the growing controversy surrounding the incident and raises serious questions about the safety protocols in place on set. The stunt coordinator's statement is a stark reminder of the risks actors face on set and the need for stricter safety measures to be put in place.

The Miss America Organization is in a state of upheaval after a shocking email scandal involving offensive language used to describe former Miss America contestants. The organization has seen the resignations of its Executive Chairman and Chief Executive, Sam Haskell, as well as Chairman Lynn Weidner and President and Chief Operating Officer Josh Randle. The resignations will be effective immediately, pending an investigation, according to a statement from interim chairman Dan Meyers.

The scandal began when internal emails were published by the Huffington Post, showing Haskell using derogatory language to describe Mallory Hagan, a former Miss America. In another email, Haskell forwarded a photo of Hagan with other former Miss Americas, joking about her physical appearance. Haskell and other officials have denied the allegations, calling the emails "dishonest, deceptive, and despicable."

The resignations come after dozens of former Miss Americas signed a petition calling on the group's leadership to step down, accusing officials of "sitting by without objection while such derisive comments were passed around." The petition called the emails "despicable" and demanded that officials take responsibility for their actions.

The resignations of Haskell, Weidner, and Randle are a first step in addressing the scandal, but many former Miss Americas and others are calling for a full housecleaning of the organization's leadership. "We will continue to demand the resignations of every individual who either participated in the abuse of women or stood by and was complicit," Gretchen Carlson, 1989 Miss America, and Kate Shindle, 1998 Miss America, said in a statement.
td_rationale: Based on the specific details provided, it is likely that this message is real. The scandal involving the offensive emails, the resignations of top officials, the internal petition signed by former Miss Americas, and the call for a further housecleaning of the organization's leadership all point to a real and significant event. The fact that the resignations are pending an investigation and have been demanded by multiple former Miss Americas adds further support to the veracity of the message. Therefore, it is more likely to be a real message, and the prediction is 1.
cs_rationale:
Based on the detailed description provided, the message appears to be describing a real event rather than a fictional scenario. The specifics of the scandal involving offensive language used by Sam Haskell, former Executive Chairman of the Miss America Organization, have been widely reported and confirmed by multiple sources including reputable news outlets like the Huffington Post. The resignations of Haskell, Lynn Weidner, and Josh Randle have been acknowledged in various news reports, indicating a significant organizational response to the scandal.

Moreover, the involvement of former Miss Americas signing a petition and issuing statements demanding accountability from the organization's leadership further supports the credibility of the events described. Given these factors, it is reasonable to assess that the message is likely describing a real and factual situation rather than a fabricated one.

Therefore, I predict the veracity of the message to be 1.

Jared Haibon and Ashley Iaconetti's relationship has caused an emotional rollercoaster for Bachelor Nation. For years, the Rhode Island couple have been in a flirty friendship, and their fans have been rooting for them to finally be together. And on Tuesday, May 22, they made their relationship official by announcing it on the TV show The Story of Us.

Nick Viall, who was a Bachelor in Paradise costar of Jared's, couldn't be happier for the couple. He took to Instagram on Wednesday, May 23, to reflect on witnessing Jared's heartbreak when Ashley was in another relationship. Nick admitted that he had doubts about the pair being meant to be, but he backtracked in his post, admitting he was wrong.

Jared opened up about his relationship with Ashley during Tuesday's episode of the Help! I Suck at Dating podcast and shut down Dean Unglert's awkward questions about the couple's sex life. He made it clear that he wasn't ready to discuss that topic.

Ashley has been vocal about her virginity since first appearing on Chris Soules' season of The Bachelor in 2015. Before she and Kevin Wendt called it quits, Ashley told Us that she is done talking about her V-card and will "never, ever, say yes or no" to fans' questions about her sex life.

This emotional journey of love and heartbreak is a testament to the power of true love, and we can't wait to see what the future holds for Jared and Ashley.
td_rationale: Based on the specific details provided in the message, it is more likely to be a real message. The inclusion of specific dates, events, and comments from individuals involved in the situation suggest that this is a real account of Jared Haibon and Ashley Iaconetti's relationship. The emotional rollercoaster, official announcement on a TV show, and public discussions about their relationship make the message appear genuine. Therefore, the predicted veracity of this message is 1.
cs_rationale:
1
Based on the specific details provided in the message about the relationship between Jared Haibon and Ashley Iaconetti, as well as the statements from other Bachelor Nation members and the public nature of their announcement, it is more likely that this is a real message. The personal reflections and emotional journey described in the message indicate that it is a real update on the couple's relationship.

content:
"EXCLUSIVE: Claire Danes Pregnant with Second Child on Hit Drama Homeland!

The stunning actress made the shocking reveal during a recent interview with Jimmy Fallon, where she joked about being "knocked up" in the first trimester of her pregnancy.

But, when it came to filming her hit drama Homeland, Danes had to keep her pregnancy a secret. "You just feel horrible. You just feel rotten and you're not allowed to say why," she confessed to Fallon. "I was filming quite a lot and just inadvertently falling asleep all the time. It was just embarrassing."

Even worse, Danes accidentally "face planted" onto a crocheted bag and left with a "third degree burn" on her face. "I have this crocheted indentation all on the side of my face. It looked like I had third degree burns," she revealed. "They were massaging my face. They had to get out the blow dryer. I halted production for a good half an hour. I felt like an idiot."

Despite all the drama, Danes is now in the "cruisy second trimester" and can't wait for her second child to move and kick. "It gets a little excited when I have a chocolate bar. It's moving and kicking," she said. "I love that part. It's like a fireworks show every so often. It's really cool and a little creepy. It is, it's like an alien being in there, cohabitating, yeah, AirBNB."

Danes and her husband, Hugh Dancy, are already parents to 5-year-old son Cyrus. Get the latest on their relationship and more in the clip below!"
td_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific information provided, including direct quotes from Claire Danes and her experiences during her pregnancy, it is more likely that this is a real message. The use of direct quotes and specific details about her pregnancy, such as accidental injury and filming while pregnant, add to the credibility of the message. Furthermore, the mention of her husband, Hugh Dancy, and their existing child adds to the authenticity of the message. Therefore, this message is more likely to be real, so the veracity prediction is 1.
cs_rationale:
Based on the provided message, several elements suggest it could be a real event rather than fabricated:

1. **Specific Details and Quotes**: The message includes specific quotes allegedly from Claire Danes during an interview with Jimmy Fallon. This level of detail implies a structured narrative typical of real celebrity announcements.

2. **Emotional and Personal Insights**: Claire Danes discusses personal experiences related to her pregnancy, such as feeling "horrible" and accidentally injuring herself on set. These intimate details add credibility to the story.

3. **Mentions of Public Figures**: It mentions Claire Danes and her husband Hugh Dancy, which are well-known public figures. Such mentions are common in genuine celebrity news.

4. **Consistent Storyline**: The story follows a coherent timeline of events related to pregnancy and filming challenges, which aligns with known issues faced by actresses when dealing with pregnancies during filming.

Considering these points, the message appears to be more likely a real announcement rather than fabricated gossip. Hence, the prediction would be:

**Prediction: 1**

The source also mentioned that the feud is affecting the entire series and tension on the set is at an all-time high. It was reported that Kidman and Witherspoon each received between $250,000 and $350,000 per episode for the first season, while Streep is reportedly making around $800,000 per episode for her role in the second season. Despite this, Witherspoon recently posted a picture of the four actresses together, captioning it "We work and we play! Bowl-a-Rama party with the ladies of Big Little Lies."

Additionally, the mention of salary discrepancies between the actresses could be sensationalized or exaggerated. The claim suggests there is an "epic falling-out" between them, which allegedly affects the entire series and has created high tension on set. To assess the veracity of this message, several points can be considered:

2. **Plausibility**: While tensions on sets of popular shows are not uncommon, claims of an "epic falling-out" and its significant impact on the series require substantial evidence to be considered likely.

3. **Contextual Evidence**: The contrast in salaries and the recent social media post by Witherspoon suggest some level of camaraderie, potentially contradicting the severity of the claimed tensions.

4. **Media Dynamics**: Reports of on-set tensions often attract attention and can be exaggerated or distorted for dramatic effect.

Given these points, while conflicts among actors can occur, the severity and broad impact described in the message are not substantiated with concrete evidence. Without more reliable sourcing or direct evidence of such tensions affecting production, the message leans towards being less credible.

**Verdict**: 0

Law enforcement officials didn't name Rihanna as a reason for Feratovic's arrest, but the article notes that a man with the same name left a comment on a Facebook post about the singer in March 2017, asking, "Why she is not with me?" In September of 2017, the Twitter user posted bizarre tweets about Rihanna, Beyoncé, and Nicki Minaj, including claims that he has "kids" with Rihanna and that he loves them. Feratovic's Twitter account has since been deleted, but not before he made a series of tweets that raised eyebrows.

Feratovic has a criminal trespassing arrest at the same apartment building from May of 2016, adding to his long list of legal troubles. It's unclear if Feratovic will face charges for his latest arrest.

The House of Representatives recently passed a health care bill aimed at repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare). The bill passed with a narrow margin, 217-213, and was met with criticism from numerous Hollywood stars who took to Twitter to voice their opinions against the bill.

The Republican-backed measure will keep children on family policies until age 26 but will also cut the Medicaid program for low-income people and end tax penalties in the Affordable Care Act on the health industry and those who earn high-paying salaries. The bill will also block federal payments to Planned Parenthood for a year and allows states to get waivers to free insurers from coverage requirements, which could cause them to charge people with pre-existing illnesses higher rates than they charge healthy customers.

In response to the bill's passage, President Trump expressed confidence in the bill's success and stated that it was a repeal and replace of Obamacare. However, many people, including Jimmy Kimmel and George Takei, expressed their views on equal healthcare for those with pre-existing conditions, such as their newborn son.

The hashtag #IAmAPreexistingCondition quickly became a trending topic, and America Ferrera, Sarah Hyland, Mark Ruffalo, and George Takei were among those who expressed their views on Twitter. The bill now heads to the Senate, where its fate is uncertain.
td_rationale: The message seems likely to be a real one (1) based on the detailed description of the House of Representatives passing a health care bill aimed at repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act, the specific provisions of the bill such as cutting the Medicaid program, ending tax penalties, and allowing states to get waivers for coverage requirements, the reaction from President Trump, Hollywood stars, and the public on social media, and the mention of the bill's uncertain fate in the Senate. The level of detail and the specific references to public figures and trending hashtags suggest that the message is more likely to be real.
cs_rationale: Based on the specific details provided in the message, it is likely to be a real message. The passage of a health care bill by the House of Representatives with a narrow margin, the reactions of numerous Hollywood stars on Twitter, and the specific provisions and potential consequences of the bill all point to the veracity of the message. Additionally, the mention of President Trump's response and the trending hashtag #IAmAPreexistingCondition further support the likelihood that this is a real message. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.

"The end is near," a tweet from Pauley Perrette sends shockwaves among NCIS fans. The actress, who plays forensic scientist Abby Sciuto on the popular CBS procedural, shared a link to an MSN story about three men agreeing to settle Federal Trade Commission charges surrounding fraudulent internet-marketing practices. The settlement, which carries a hefty $179 million fine, prohibits the men from using deceptive marketing techniques, including "bogus celebrity endorsements," according to the FTC statement. This comes a day after Perrette had tweeted that ads for a skin care line continued to use her image without permission. She added that the misleading promos include "lies" about her leaving "NCIS" to focus on cosmetics. "They caught 'em!" the actress tweeted Thursday. "Hopefully these false ads will end now! I DON'T have a skin care line!" On Wednesday, she wrote, "I'M NOT LEAVING NCIS FOR A SKIN CARE LINE! I'm leaving, but that's not why." "NCIS" fans have been struggling to grapple with Perrette's impending departure after she announced last month that the show's currently airing Season 15 will be her last. She has not given a specific reason for walking away. Perrette's latest tweet is below.

They caught 'em! Hopefully these false ads will end now! I DON'T have a skin care line! https://t.co/wOmdRioUFy — Pauley Perrette (@PauleyP) November 15, 2017

"NCIS" airs Tuesdays at 8/7c on CBS.]
td_rationale: Based on the information provided, the message seems to be real. Pauley Perrette, the actress who plays Abby Sciuto on NCIS, tweeted about false advertising using her image for a skin care line without her permission. She also referenced the settlement of the Federal Trade Commission charges against three men for fraudulent internet-marketing practices. Given the specific details and context provided in the message, it is more likely to be a real message. Therefore, the prediction is 1.
cs_rationale: The message is likely to be real as it provides specific details about a legal settlement involving fraudulent internet-marketing practices and the unauthorized use of the actress's image for a skin care line. Pauley Perrette's tweets and the details of the settlement are specific and verifiable, suggesting that the message is real. Additionally, the message aligns with previous public statements made by the actress about her departure from the show. Therefore, the veracity of the message is likely to be real, so the prediction is 1.

The United States Senate voted on Tuesday to allow debate on the American Health Care Act (AHCA), a bill that could repeal the Affordable Care Act (ACA), also known as Obamacare. Hollywood celebrities immediately expressed their disdain through social media.

Mark Ruffalo, an environmental activist, tweeted that "democracy is in cardiac arrest." Debra Messing described it as "a sad day in US History." Cher referenced Franklin D. Roosevelt's speech asking Congress to go to war in 1941, comparing Japan's attack on Pearl Harbor to the GOP's actions. Other celebrities, such as Billy Eichner, Josh Gad, Rob Delaney, and Seth Meyers, also expressed their opinions on the matter.

Jon Favreau and "House of Cards" creator Beau Willimon maintained that the vote was a small step towards passage of the bill and that there is still time to defeat it. Sophia Bush, Kate Walsh, Kal Penn, and George Takei urged the public to demand action from their senators. Other celebrities, such as Lena Dunham, Margaret Cho, and Jaime King, called for support for ACA and Planned Parenthood, which faces defunding if the proposed bill passes.

While the bill passed a motion to proceed, it has not yet been passed and the fight to "kill the bill" continues. The public is encouraged to call their senators and show up at their offices if they are able to do so.
td_rationale: This message is more likely to be a real message as it describes a specific event and quotes the statements of several well-known figures. The detailed description of the reactions from celebrities through social media indicates that the event is real and did occur. Additionally, the mention of a specific bill and the call for public action further supports the likelihood of the message being real. Therefore, it is more likely to be a real message, so the predicted veracity is 1.

The information in this message seems factually accurate based on publicly available sources. However since we cannot verify if these statements were actually made by these celebrities or if they accurately represent their viewpoint and sentiment towards political issue without more specific information about their statements or actions regarding AHCA/ACA debate.

Given these limitations and lack of specific evidence in this message for further analysis , it is not possible to accurately determine its veracity. Therefore a neutral should be taken and a label of undetermined should be assigned rather than providing an ambiguous assessment such as 0 or 1.

Ryan Gosling, an actor known for his captivating performances, is set to star in two highly anticipated films: La La Land and Blade Runner. His talent has earned him numerous accolades and has left many fans breathless.

One of his most memorable performances is in the film Crazy, Stupid, Love, where he initiates a re-enactment of the famous Dirty Dancing Scene with Emma Stone. This scene has been praised for its charm and the actors' ability to create a memorable moment.

In the film The Place Beyond the Pines, Ryan plays a bank robber determined to provide for his son, showing a mix of toughness and vulnerability. The scene where he instigates the bank robbery has been praised for its realism and his ability to convey emotions without dialogue.

Drive is a pulp thriller where Gosling plays a stunt driver who works for criminals as a getaway driver. The opening scene, where he picks up his latest comrades from a burgled jewellery store, is considered one of the most edge-of-your-seat cinematic moments due to the suspense and lack of dialogue.

In the film Blue Valentine, Ryan plays a character who sings and plays the ukulele while Michelle Williams tap dances. The scene has been praised for its endearing performance and the actors' ability to create a memorable moment.

Half Nelson is a film where Ryan plays an inner-city teacher who is found taking crack cocaine in a store cupboard by a young student. His performance in the film earned him an Oscar nomination for Best Actor in Leading Role.

After a break from acting in 2013, Ryan returned with a performance in The Big Short, where he explained the housing market collapse in America using Jenga. His performance alongside Steve Carell, Brad Pitt, Christain Bale, and Marisa Tomei earned him six Oscar nominations.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed description of Ryan Gosling's various performances in different films, including specific scenes and critical acclaim, the message is more likely to be real. The specific examples provided, such as his roles in "Crazy, Stupid, Love," "The Place Beyond the Pines," and his Oscar-nominated performance in "Half Nelson," suggest that the information is accurate and not fabricated. The level of detail and coherence in describing his career and performances also adds to the credibility of the message. Therefore, the veracity of the message is predicted to be 1.
cs_rationale:
The message describes Ryan Gosling's career and performances in various films, including details about specific scenes and accolades. It provides a coherent narrative about his roles and achievements in the film industry. However, upon closer inspection, several statements appear inaccurate or exaggerated:

1. **La La Land and Blade Runner**: While Ryan Gosling did star in these films, the message implies he starred in them simultaneously, which is not accurate chronologically.
   
2. **The Big Short**: Ryan Gosling was part of the ensemble cast of "The Big Short" and did not receive six Oscar nominations; the film itself received several nominations.

3. **Drive**: The description of the opening scene of "Drive" is subjective ("considered one of the most edge-of-your-seat cinematic moments") and doesn't directly relate to verifiable facts.

Considering these inaccuracies and embellishments, the message seems more like a dramatized or exaggerated portrayal rather than a factual account. Therefore, I would predict its veracity as 0.

That same day, the Hills star, who is also a devoted mother, revealed the names of the costars from the show she has given parenting advice to. In a heartwarming interview with the Today show, she confessed that she has talked babies with Audrina Patridge, who welcomed her daughter last year, and Heidi Montag, who is pregnant with her first child.

However, she did not mention Lauren Conrad or Whitney Port, who are both also pregnant with their first children. It seems that Kristin has a special bond with Audrina, as she revealed that when Audrina was pregnant, she reached out to her for advice and support.

"When Audrina was pregnant, she reached out a lot and asked me some questions, like what pregnancy jeans I liked, and that kind of stuff," said Kristin. "I've talked to her since she's had the baby, and she sounds like she's just loving life."

Kristin is also very close to Heidi, who is married to Spencer Pratt. In fact, she put together a list of different products and toys that she had loved and sent that over to Heidi. "I put together a little list of different products and toys that I've loved and sent that over to her," said Kristin.

Being a mother is a lot of work, especially when your boys are as rambunctious as Kristin's. "My boys are so close in age, so one minute they're best friends and one minute they're hitting each other, punching each other," she said. "They get very violent with each other...I think just right now, that's the hardest part."

Despite the challenges, Kristin is grateful for her beautiful family. "They're so sweet, they're incredibly loving, and they love to cuddle and they love their mommy. And that's the best feeling in the entire world," she said.

Kristin also revealed that her daughter, Saylor, is a "diva" who loves to roughhouse and is very different from her brothers. "She's a diva, but she's a ton of fun...She may as well be another boy because she's the third so she wants to do whatever the boys are doing. She's pretty tough," said Kristin.

In conclusion, Kristin Cavallari is not only a stunning mother and fashion icon, but she is also a kind and supportive friend to many of her costars. Her love for her family and her dedication to being a mother are truly inspiring.

Fiona the hippo was born prematurely at the Cincinnati Zoo on Jan. 24, weighing just 29 pounds, far too light for her species which typically weighs between 55 and 120 pounds at birth. With her weak and unstable veins, Fiona's condition quickly worsened and the zoo called on the nearby Cincinnati Children's hospital for help.

The Vascular Access Team at the hospital used ultrasound equipment to place an IV catheter in Fiona's leg, a delicate and risky procedure. After multiple failed attempts, the team successfully placed a life-saving catheter, giving Fiona the fluids she needed to recover.

Fiona's caregivers lay her on their chests to help her regulate her breathing, and despite a weak start at bottle feeding, she showed progress by early February. She took her first steps on Feb. 5, a milestone that would allow her to be reunited with her mother. Another important step is getting used to the water, as seen in the video above, where Fiona swims and dives happily in a tub.

Fiona's recovery is a testament to the power of love and care, and the zoo is keeping the public updated on her status. Donations are also being accepted to help cover the costs of keeping Fiona happy and healthy. Let us all pray for Fiona's full recovery and a bright future filled with love and adventure.
