The Queen's annual train journey to Sandringham is a well-known and beloved tradition, one that she has kept for years. She travels from London King's Cross to King's Lynn on a regular commuter train, a journey that takes her 90 minutes and costs around £56.10 for first class.

The Queen's love of the train is well documented, and she is often seen travelling on the Thameslink service to and from Norfolk. Her Majesty's commitment to her annual train journey to Sandringham is a testament to her dedication to her people and her love of the simple pleasures in life.

As the Queen's security team has been known to travel on the same train as her, passengers have been honoured to have the Queen as a regular commuter on the same train. The Eastern Daily Press reported in 2016 that the station manager described it as an "honour" to have the Queen use the train service.

The Queen and Prince Philip typically spend the rest of the winter period at Sandringham, where they stay until February. As the anniversary of the Queen's father's death falls on February 6, 1952, this time of year holds great meaning for the Queen and her family.

As we reflect on the Queen's dedication to her people and her love of the simple pleasures in life, let us join with the rest of the nation in wishing the Queen and the royal family a very happy Christmas.

15 of 15 1983 Nicole Kidman, a young and vibrant woman with big curls, posed for a photo call for her first-ever movie, BMX Bandits, in her hometown of Sydney. She had just made her debut in the Australian film Bush Christmas that same year. Kidman's career in Australia would continue for a few more years, as she worked in both movies and TV.

But it was her international breakout role in 1989's Dead Calm that would change the course of her life. She portrayed the wife of a naval officer in the thrilling Australian thriller, and it was this movie that caught the attention of audiences worldwide and launched her into American cinema.

Her arrival to the American movie industry was in the film Days of Thunder in 1990, where she met Tom Cruise, who would become her husband. They tied the knot on December 24, 1990, in Telluride, Colorado. They appeared together at the Academy Awards in 1991, where Kidman earned her first-ever Golden Globe nomination for her role in the film Billy Bathgate.

However, their marriage was not meant to last. In February 2001, the couple announced their separation, and quickly after, they filed for divorce. It was a tough year for Kidman, but it was also a professional highlight, as her performance in the film Moulin Rouge earned her her first Oscar nomination and Golden Globe award, for best actress in a motion picture - musical or comedy.

After her divorce from Cruise, Kidman found love again with the musician Lenny Kravitz, but their relationship was brief and intense. They were even engaged, but Kidman revealed in 2017 that they had called things off in 2004. Kidman spoke about a secret fiancé to Vanity Fair in 2007, saying "It just wasn't right. I wasn't ready. We weren't ready."

Things are all good between Kidman and Kravitz now. She told NET-A-PORTER.com's magazine, The EDIT, "I love Lenny; he's a great guy." In 2006, Kidman married her current husband, Keith Urban, in Sydney, Australia. They have two daughters together, Sunday Rose and Faith Margaret. Kidman continued her career success, earning Oscar and Golden Globe nominations for her film Rabbit Hole in 2011, and a Golden Globe nod for her film The Paperboy in 2013. And her show Big Little Lies with Reese Witherspoon, Laura Dern, Shailene Woodley, and Zoe Kravitz, the daughter of her ex-fiancé Lenny Kravitz, earned her critical acclaim and numerous nominations. The past decade has been a big one for Kidman, and she is still as strong as ever with Urban by her side.

"A groundbreaking moment in Grammy history was made on Sunday night as Alessia Cara became the only woman to present a solo Grammy during the awards telecast, taking home the prestigious Best New Artist award. However, the Recording Academy president Neil Portnow's comments on the #GrammysSoMale controversy left many feeling unimpressed.

Portnow boldly declared that "women who have the creativity in their hearts and souls, who want to be musicians, engineers, producers, and executives in the industry, need to step up." He added, "I don't have personal experience of those kinds of brick walls that you face but I think it's upon us — us as an industry — to make the welcome mat very obvious, breeding opportunities for all people who want to be creative and create that next generation of artists."

Despite Portnow's words, the Grammys producer Ken Ehrlich refused to address the issue, simply stating, "It's not for me to talk about. I produce the TV show." When asked about the lack of an onstage moment for Album of the Year nominee Lorde, Ehrlich gave a vague answer, "I don't know if it was a mistake. These shows are a matter of choices. We have a box and it gets full."

However, the pre-telecast ceremony did see several female winners, including Lisa Loeb, Reba McEntire, Aimee Mann, and Carrie Fisher. Rihanna even shared a win with Kendrick Lamar for Best Rap/Sung Performance for the song "Loyalty." Chris Stapleton, who won Best Country Album, was more diplomatic, stating that "equality is something we have to address on a lot of levels."

One thing is for sure, the attendance of Taylor Swift will be crucial in determining if she will be present at next year's ceremony."

Robert Osborne, the host of Turner Classic Movies since its launch in 1994, has passed away at the age of 84. He had been suffering from undisclosed health problems. Osborne was an indispensable guide to viewers who tuned in everyday to hear his thoughts on Hollywood and film. He was an expert on the history of the Oscars and authored several books on the subject, including "Academy Awards Illustrated" and "The Official History of the Academy Awards."

Longtime friend Liza Minnelli paid tribute to Osborne, stating that his knowledge of Hollywood and film was second to none. TCM shared a touching video with Osborne's friends and colleagues, which included industry figures such as Cher, Patton Oswalt, Patricia Arquette, Gilbert Gottfried, and others expressing their grief on social media.

The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences also paid tribute to Osborne, stating that he worked tirelessly to document the organization's rich history and was a beloved friend. Osborne was a remarkable and special man who brought joy to people around the world by sharing his knowledge and love of film.

Our thoughts are with all who love and mourn the passing of Robert Osborne.

The Vampire Diaries alum, Steven R. McQueen, has ended his engagement to Alexandra Silva, leaving his fans heartbroken and confused.

The 29-year-old actor revealed the news at the Voices in Displacement Gala hosted by the Syrian American Medical Society on Friday. When asked about the status of their wedding planning, he simply said, "You know what? Actually, we called it off."

McQueen, named after his grandfather, Steve McQueen, had announced the engagement news to Silva on Instagram in January, sharing a photo of the two holding hands and sharing a kiss, giving fans a glimpse of her new engagement ring. Silva reposted the photo on her own Instagram account, captioning it, "My best friend, love of my life…YES, yes yes a million times over."

However, the last photo of McQueen on Silva's account dates back to January 1, and both posts have since been deleted. It's unclear what caused the split or whether the couple plans to remain friends.

Before getting engaged, the couple had been dating for over a year. McQueen is best known for playing Jeremy Gilbert on The Vampire Diaries from 2009-15, and he has also starred in Chicago Fire and Chicago P.D.

While many fans are heartbroken by the news, we hope that both McQueen and Silva find happiness in the future.

content:
The biggest fashion faux pas for a wedding guest would be to upstage the bride. With all the attention and speculation surrounding Kate Middleton's gown for her upcoming royal wedding, it would be nearly impossible to do. However, there are other unwritten rules that guests should consider. Don't wear white, anything too revealing, or a hat that is too wide or tall to block the view of the person behind you. You can wear tasteful black, and be sure to cover your arms.

"This is not a place to make a fashion statement for yourself," said Sally Kilbridge, deputy editor of Brides magazine. She goes on to list more don'ts, including no miniskirts, plunging necklines, and novelty socks, which have become a surprising trend among guests at American weddings. The attire worn to a British royal wedding is appropriate daytime wedding attire kicked up many notches, Kilbridge said. Everyone's outfit should be chic, elegant, and suit the very formal, traditional occasion while not letting glitzy, black-tie, eveningwear trappings creep in.

Designer Reem Acra thinks Westminster Abbey could be the place for cocktail frocks, especially for celebrities and fashion editors who have long found reason to wear them before noon. The fashion role model for older women should be well-cut, luxe-fabric skirt suits, while Middleton's younger friends could pull off slightly retro, Hitchcock-inspired sheaths or pencil skirts paired with nipped-waist jackets. George Kotsiopoulos, co-host of E!'s Fashion Police, expects a lot of hats, but hopes they'll be toned-down cloches or a pillbox with a veil.

Vivien Sheriff, a British milliner who has made several dozen custom headpieces for wedding guests, said many guests will follow the lead of Middleton's mother, Carole, who is a fan of substantial hats. The hats Sheriff has made feature some feathers and crystals, but they're not oversized. "You can't show off too much. You don't want to overdo it, but there is a lot of expression in the headpieces." Sheriff added that people aren't going to want to hide their faces, so the brims won't cover them. "This way, everyone can get good photos and you can greet other guests looking them in the eye."

There will be more black than one might expect, Sheriff said. She had more orders for black than she expected. "I guess fashion has changed and a lot of young guests want to wear black." However, black is fine as long as it's not funereal, according to Brides' Kilbridge, although the Middleton family won't wear it. Prince Charles' wife, Camilla, won't wear it either, Kilbridge predicted. Camilla will likely pluck something she already had in her closet, Kilbridge said, probably something not unlike the tailored dress and lovely coat she wore to her own wedding.

Most of the male guests will likely don a navy or gray morning suit, which is basically the daytime equivalent of a tuxedo including a vest or waistcoat. All of William's military friends will be in uniform, Kilbridge said. A guest with a well-known personal style has a little more flexibility, said Kilbridge. It would be perfectly acceptable for Elton John, for example, to wear a flashy, embroidered vest under his jacket. Fashion fans will be eager to see David and Victoria Beckham, and Kilbridge thinks they won't disappoint, although she wonders how Victoria Beckham will dress her baby bump. "They've had some crazy fashion moments, but this won't be one of them. She'll probably look fantastic. They want to create the impression that she belongs there. I think most people will be striving to look like they belong." That might have singer Joss Stone, who is famously barefoot almost everywhere she goes, digging to the bottom of her closet looking for a pair of shoes.
td_rationale: This message is likely to be a real message. It provides detailed descriptions of the expected attire for guests at a British royal wedding, including quotes from professionals in the fashion industry. The information is specific and detailed, providing insight into not only the attire expectations but also the anticipated fashion choices of specific guests. The level of detail and specificity suggests that this message is more likely to be real, and thus I will return 1.

"Breaking the Record: Selena Gomez Named Billboard's 2017 Woman of the Year!"

The music world is abuzz with the announcement that Selena Gomez has been named Billboard's 2017 Woman of the Year. The award-winning singer, producer, and actress will be presented with the prestigious honor at the annual Women in Music dinner and awards gala on Nov. 30 in Los Angeles.

Gomez joins an illustrious list of previous honorees, including Lady Gaga, Taylor Swift, Pink, Katy Perry, Fergie, Beyoncé, and last year's winner, Madonna, who made headlines with her powerful speech on feminism and sexism.

"Selena Gomez is not only soaring to the top of the charts with her latest hits, but she is also inspiring young women everywhere to be authentic, give back, and not be afraid to use their voice," said John Amato, president of The Hollywood Reporter-Billboard Media Group. "She is fearless in speaking her mind and has used her platform to advocate for the needs of others. We are thrilled to be able to honor her as our Woman of the Year."

Gomez's career has never been better, with hits such as "Same Old Love," "Hands to Myself," and "We Don't Talk Anymore" dominating the Billboard Hot 100. Her albums have also been a major force, with Revival and Stars Dance leading the charts in 2015 and 2013 respectively.

In addition to her music career, Gomez has also made a name for herself in the world of philanthropy, raising over $500,000 for the Lupus Research Alliance and serving as an active ambassador for UNICEF since 2009.

This year's Women in Music event will also recognize the most powerful female executives in the industry, with additional honorees to be announced in due course. And for the first time, the event and a red-carpet pre-show will be broadcast live on Twitter from 9pm-midnight EST on Nov. 30. Sponsors of the 2017 edition include Twitter, American Airlines, Iron Mountain Entertainment Services, and Nielsen Music.

This is a huge moment for Selena Gomez, and one that is sure to inspire millions of young women around the world. She is a true icon, and we can't wait to see what she does next.

CAITLYN JENNER UNVEILS TRUTH ABOUT KYLIE JENNER'S BIRTH, AND IT'S NOT WHAT YOU EXPECT!

The Kardashian family has been rocked by a shocking revelation about the birth of Kylie Jenner's daughter, Stormi. According to a new sneak peek of the latest episode of Keeping Up with the Kardashians, Kris Jenner, the matriarch of the family, has revealed that she was the one who delivered her daughter's baby!

Kris gushed over Kylie, describing her as "such a trooper" throughout the delivery. "She was so calm," Kris said. "It was really exciting. I delivered the baby! I delivered her. I pulled her out."

But that's not all. Kris also shared that Kylie didn't feel much pain during the delivery. "She just kept saying, 'I don't feel any pain,'" Kris said. "And you'd see the contractions like crazy and she would say, 'I'm just not feeling it,' and I would say, 'This is really weird.'"

Kris's revelation comes as a surprise, as People magazine first reported Kylie's pregnancy news back in September 2017. But Kylie didn't personally confirm them until after she gave birth.

Kylie shared an Instagram post with fans as well as a 10-minute video of her pregnancy journey on YouTube. "I knew for myself I needed to prepare for this role of a lifetime in the most positive, stress-free and healthy way I knew how," Kylie said. "There was no gotcha moment, no big paid reveal I had planned. I knew my baby would feel every stress and every emotion so I chose to do it this way for my little life and our happiness."

Kylie isn't the only sister who has had a unique baby delivery. Back in 2009, when older sister Kourtney gave birth to her first child with ex-boyfriend Scott Disick, Mason, the star famously pulled out her own baby during the delivery. In a 2016 interview with Today Extra, she revealed that it was her then boyfriend Disick who had filmed the birth that was aired on the family's reality show.

Kris is now a grandmother to nine grandkids. This story originally appeared on Fox News and is republished here with permission.

content:
The Harvey Weinstein scandal has taken another devastating turn as the embattled producer was expelled from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences board on Saturday. The board, who reviewed Weinstein's membership during an emergency meeting, released a statement saying it "voted well in excess of the required two-thirds majority to immediately expel him from the Academy."

The statement from the Academy read, "We do so not simply to separate ourselves from someone who does not merit the respect of his colleagues but also to send a message that the era of willful ignorance and shameful complicity in sexually predatory behavior and workplace harassment in our industry is over. What’s at issue here is a deeply troubling problem that has no place in our society. The Board continues to work to establish ethical standards of conduct that all Academy members will be expected to exemplify."

Mia Farrow, whose son Ronan recently published a New Yorker investigation with rape and sexual assault allegations against Weinstein's, took to Twitter to express her support of the board's decision. She wrote, "I'm proud of the Academy for voting to expel Harvey Weinstein. Hopelessly grateful that we are witnessing the end of an awful era."

Ron Perlman also expressed his pride in the Academy's decision to expel Weinstein, tweeting, "I'm proud of their decision to expel Harvey Weinstein. Time to make Hollywood great again."

Marlee Matlin tweeted her support for the Academy, highlighting the issue of willful ignorance and complicity, tweeting, "Bravo to the Academy for highlighting willful ignorance and complicity."

This move comes after several Hollywood figures known for alleged sexual misconduct, including Roman Polanski and Bill Cosby, remain members of the Academy. Weinstein, who has been accused of sexual assault by numerous actresses, becomes the second person ever to be kicked out of the Academy, after Godfather actor Carmine Caridi, who was removed in 2004 for illegally sharing Oscar screeners.

The Weinstein Company, which he helped to found, has fired him, and his wife, fashion designer Georgina Chapman, announced she was leaving him. In an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, Weinstein's brother Bob spoke of his "waking nightmare" and expressed his desire for his brother to receive "the justice he deserves."

The fallout from the Harvey Weinstein scandal continues more than a week after an explosive New York Times investigation detailed decades of sexual harassment accusations against Weinstein. The scandal has rocked Hollywood to its core and has sparked a much-needed conversation about the culture of silence and the systemic issues that allowed such abuse to go on for so long.
td_rationale: The veracity of the message appears to be real, as it reports specific events and statements from credible sources such as the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences Mia Farrow, Ron Perlman, and Marlee Matlin. The expulsion of Weinstein from the Academy was well-documented in various news outlets. Additionally, the message outlines a sequence of events to the Harvey Weinstein scandal that align with multiple other reports from sources. Therefore, it is more likely to be a real message. I return 1 for its veracity.

Over the weekend, news emerged that Sharon and Ozzy Osbourne had separated after nearly 34 years of marriage. The couple, who have three children together - Aimee, Kelly, and Jack - faced numerous conflicting and salacious reports about their split. Some alleged that Ozzy had disappeared after his wife threw him out of their home, while others claimed he had an affair with a celebrity hairdresser. There were also concerns that Ozzy had relapsed, as he did the last time the couple split in 2013.

However, Ozzy addressed these rumors on Monday, telling E! News that the split had nothing to do with a relapse. "I have been sober for three and a quarter years, I have not touched drugs or alcohol in that time," he said. A source also told E! that the pair mutually agreed that Ozzy would temporarily move out of the house.

Ozzy was spotted on Monday morning in Los Angeles, contrary to what other outlets had alleged. He was also seen with his daughter Aimee, who is rarely seen in public. Sharon Osbourne, who did not attend Monday's taping of The Talk, addressed her absence on Tuesday's show. "There were many tabloid headlines this past weekend about her and Ozzy," Julie Chen said. "Rumors and speculation that they have split up after nearly 34 years of marriage. Sharon understandably took today off. We are sending all of our love to her and her family, and we ask that you do the same."

Sharon Osbourne resumed her duties at The Talk on Tuesday and discussed what was happening in her personal life. Comedian Kathy Griffin reacted to Weinstein's arrest with a strongly worded message, while actress Rosanna Arquette replied to an internet commenter who criticized her for not speaking up earlier. Most of the women who have come forward with allegations against Weinstein have faced threats and have had their stories ignored, Arquette pointed out.

On Saturday evening, a group of 82 women, including Cate Blanchett, Kristen Stewart, Jane Fonda, and Ava DuVernay, held a silent protest on the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival. The women stood together in solidarity, calling for greater representation and equal opportunities in the film industry.

In a joint statement, Blanchett and French director Agnes Varda emphasized the need for transparency and parity in executive bodies and work environments. They called for governments to enforce equal pay laws and for workplaces to be diverse and equitable. The women also acknowledged the efforts of those standing for change and called for the industry's stairways to be accessible to all.

The protest was part of the 5050x2020 movement, which seeks to achieve gender parity across all aspects of the film industry by the year 2020. The number 82 was selected to match the number of films directed by women in the festival's history, with only 4.3% of competition films in the past 71 years being directed by women.

Other notable women involved in the protest included Salma Hayek, Marion Cotillard, director Patty Jenkins, and Haifaa al-Mansour. The protest was organized by French group Le Deuxieme Regard and the 5050x2020 collective, in collaboration with the Cannes Film Festival.

The protest comes in the wake of the Harvey Weinstein scandal and the #MeToo and Time's Up movements, which have sparked a renewed demand for change in the film industry. The movement also echoes broader calls for gender equality and diversity in the workplace.

While progress has been made in recent years, with more women making the cut in competition, the statistics for women in Cannes are still dismal. Only one woman has won the Palme d'Or, and only one woman has been named Best Director. The festival has been criticized for its lack of diversity and inclusion, and for failing to provide a platform for women filmmakers.

However, the rise of women in the film industry is undeniable, and the protest at Cannes highlights the need for continued efforts to promote gender equality and diversity in the industry. As the movement continues to gain momentum, it remains to be seen what concrete actions will be taken to address these issues and create a more inclusive and equitable film industry.
td_rationale: This message is likely to be real. It is specific in its details, mentioning the names of celebrities, the specific purpose of the protest, and the organizations involved. The message also discusses the broader context of the Harvey Weinstein scandal, the #MeToo and Time's Up movements, which lends credibility to the content. Additionally, the mention of specific statistics and historical facts about the Cannes Film Festival adds to the veracity of the message. Overall, the message appears to be real, so I will return 1.

Colton Haynes, a beloved actor and advocate for the LGBTQ+ community, has shared a heart-wrenching message about Hollywood's treatment of LGBT actors. In a series of tweets on August 29, Haynes criticized the industry for placing too much emphasis on actors' personal lives and not enough on their talent.

"Hollywood is so f**ked up," he wrote. "So much of the focus is on your personal life & has nothing to do with the talent you have to bring to the table."

He then praised American Horror Story creator Ryan Murphy, Arrow executive producer Greg Berlanti, and Teen Wolf creator Jeff Davis for giving him opportunities and recognizing that being gay is more than just a part of his personal life. "Thank god for Ryan Murphy, Greg Berlanti, & Jeff Davis," Haynes tweeted. "They believe gay actors are more than just their personal lives."

Haynes, who came out as gay in 2016 and is engaged to celebrity floral designer Jeff Leatham, has previously spoken about the struggles he faced in Hollywood due to his sexuality. He revealed that people in the industry had advised him to hide his relationship, and that he was even set up with girls for press.

However, Haynes is no longer alone in his fight for LGBTQ+ representation in Hollywood. He is grateful for the showrunners who embrace people's personal lives and their truth, and he is excited to see the change that is happening in the industry.

"So disappointed in how Hollywood can't understand that playing a character has nothing to do with how u live your personal life," Haynes wrote. "But not anymore. You have all these amazing showrunners who actually embrace people's personal lives and embrace people's truth."

Haynes' message is a powerful reminder that everyone, regardless of their sexual orientation or gender identity, deserves to be treated with respect and recognized for their talent. It is a message that we all need to hear, and it is one that we should all strive to live by.

She said, "David respects me so much that he will literally forget what sex I am," adding, "He sometimes refers to me as a 'he' without realizing it." This comment raises questions about gender identity and the dynamics between directors and actors in their working relationships.

This dynamic can lead to interesting collaborations, as some actors are recognized as muses who inspire the male directors who create scenarios around them and explore their faces with the camera. Many muses have become partners or wives, such as Ingrid Bergman with Roberto Rossellini and Anna Karina with Jean-Luc Godard. It has been reported that Brad Pitt does not have a rare condition known as prosopagnosia, also known as face blindness. Prosopagnosia is a neurological disorder that affects an individual's ability to recognize familiar faces. People with prosopagnosia may have difficulty distinguishing between different faces, even those of close friends and family members.

Additionally, it has been revealed that Brad Pitt is an honorary member of the Epidermolysis Bullosa Medical Research Foundation (EBMRF), a foundation dedicated to raising awareness and funds for the rare skin disorder, epidermolysis bullosa. This condition is also known as "the worst disease you've never heard of" and is characterized by blisters and erosions on the skin.

It is important to note that being diagnosed with a condition by a medical professional and being self-diagnosed can be two very different things. "Jessica Alba, the multi-talented mother, was out shopping with her newborn son Hayes when he suddenly needed to breastfeed. In a moment that will resonate with all moms, Alba took to a Target fitting room to find a spot to feed her baby.

The "Dark Angel" actress, who is also the co-founder of the Honest Company, shared a photo of herself feeding Hayes on Instagram, captioning it with the simple words "Tired eyes" and "Breastfeeding in a Target dressing room."

Target has a breastfeeding policy that is mommy-friendly, even in fitting rooms if others are waiting. And it's not just Alba who appreciates this. Many moms have praised Target for creating a welcoming and comfortable space for nursing mothers.

Alba, who is also a mom to Honor Marie, 9, and Haven Garner, 6, has been open about breastfeeding her 7-week-old son. She even shared updates on social media while watching Netflix and even after going to the spa.

Despite her success, Alba still feels the typical pressures of motherhood, including impromptu nursing breaks. But she knows that it's important to maintain her own sense of self and to just do the best she can.

“Any mom who all of the sudden has little people that rely heavily on them for survival needs to maintain her own sense of self,” Alba told TODAY. “You need to cut yourself some slack and bite off what you can chew. Things will be compromised and you just have to be okay with that.”

Alba's hope for her kids is simple - that they are happy and that they are developing a positive relationship with the world around them.

“I just pray that my kids are happy,” the strong mom said back in 2015. “If they’re giggling more than they’re crying, and if they’re curious and talkative, then I know they’re good.”

This is just one example of the many ways that moms are doing their best to balance their own needs with the needs of their little ones. And it's a reminder that we should all be supportive of each other, no matter what stage of motherhood we are in."

It includes specific details such as Jessica Alba's name, her children's names, her role as a co-founder of the Honest Company, and her openness about breastfeeding her newborn son.
